title: Pina
actors: Pina Bausch, Regina Advento, Malou Airaudo, Ruth Amarante, Rainer Behr, Andrey Berezin, Damiano Ottavio Bigi, Bénédicte Billet, Ales Cucek, Clementine Deluy, Josephine Ann Endicott, Lutz Förster, Pablo Aran Gimeno, Mechthild Grossmann, Silvia Farias Heredía
description: A tribute to the work of the extraordinary dancer and choreographer Pina Bausch, interpreter of a real revolution within contemporary dance.
notes: A documentary that exudes the passion and affection of a heartfelt tribute, capable of reinventing itself every few minutes through the intensity and variety of the dances and settings and captivating even the most disinterested viewer. 3D therefore finds an author's application and Wenders challenges its limits in representing movement, choosing wide focal lengths that mimic the characteristics of the human eye and also making the camera dance, to keep the sense of depth alive. As if the director and choreographer were talking one last time in a dance for two.

title: A Torinói ló
actors: Volker Spengler, János Derzsi, Erika Bók, Mihály Kormos, Ricsi
description: On January 3, 1889, Friedrich Nietzsche came out of the door of number 6 in via Carlo Alberto, in Turin, and saw a driver mistreating the horse of his team who refused to move. In Nietszche, at that sight, something broke inside: he ran to embrace the horse crying and fell into madness, from which he would never recover. Obviously nothing more was known about the horse. His story is told by this film that follows the life of the coachman, his daughter and - of course - the animal.

title: Jodaeiye Nader az Simin
actors: Leila Hatami, Peyman Moadi, Shahab Hosseini, Sareh Bayat, Sarina Farhadi, Babak Karimi, Marila Zare'i
description: Everything is ready for the departure that Simin, her husband Nader and their daughter Termeh have planned. They will leave Iran for a new life and a new nation. However, at the last minute, Nader thinks about it: he does not dare to leave his father alone, who is sick with Alzehimer. The decision wreaks havoc and Simin asks for a divorce, which the court won't grant her. He then leaves home and Termeh decides to stay with his father, hoping that his mother will return home. But the choice made by Nader, who hires a young woman to look after his father in his absence, will prove to be dramatic.
notes: Asghar Farhadi confirms himself, after the excellent About Elly, as a director capable of building relationships of tension between the characters and inserting mystery elements in almost ordinary events. The screenplay boasts diabolical perfection, where the indignation of the female characters and the irascibility of the male ones play a good game to further confuse the waters, drowning the facts in an almost inexhaustible flow of words. A real tour de force for excellently directed performers.

title: Sala samobójców
actors: Filip Bobek, Danuta Borsuk, Paulina Chapko, Krzysztof Czeczot, Krzysztof Dracz, Karolina Dryzner, Pawel Ferens, Roma Gasiorowska, Bartosz Gelner, Jakub Gierszal
description: A series of humiliating events, which occur 100 days before his graduation, pushes the privileged Dominik into a virtual world but soon his experiences relegated to the online are dangerously transformed into reality.

title: The Sunset Limited
actors: Samuel L. Jackson, Tommy Lee Jones
description: Two lonely men, the White (Tommy Lee Jones) and the Black (Samuel L. Jackson), without a name but characterized by the color of their skin, are discussing the meaning of human suffering, the existence of God and the reasons behind them. led White to attempt suicide under a subway train, the Sunset Limited. The Black, who a few hours earlier had saved White's life, tries to explain to him the reasons why life is worth living, telling how he heard the voice of God himself in the past. The result is a very close dialogue marked by the different positions of the two men: on the one hand the Black, a believing ex-prisoner, and on the other hand the White, an atheist professor.
notes: Television adaptation of the novel "The Sunset Limited" by the American writer Cormac McCarthy, who also wrote the screenplay.

title: Drive
actors: Ryan Gosling, Carey Mulligan, Ron Perlman, Oscar Isaac, Christina Hendricks, Bryan Cranston, Albert Brooks, Tina Huang, Joe Pingue, Tiara Parker
description: A man (without a name) with a passion for cars divides his day life between working as a mechanic and as a stuntman for the cinema and, in the night, occasionally, he also turns into a driver for criminals. While his garage manager Shannon gets him a deal with a powerful local boss to introduce him to pro racing, he meets and falls in love with Irene, his neighbor with a dependent child and her husband in jail. When he returns to freedom, the underworld comes forward immediately boasting an open account and coming to threaten the woman and the child. Worried about their fate, the mechanic / stuntman decides to make himself available to the man as a pilot for the blow that should allow him to pay off the debt and free himself: but nothing goes right, and the situation becomes even more complicated.
notes: Winding Refn, perhaps the only (European) director who has been able to push forward the limit of observation and tremor towards the exploration of violence (there is more blood in his films than in all of Scorsese's put together), signs a noir that has something classic in its effective schematism and something humanistic in its sentimentality that Nick Ray would not have minded.

title: Las acacias
actors: Germán de Silva, Nayra Calle Mamani, Hebe Duarte
description: Rubén knows like the back of his hand the highway that leads from Asunción, in Paraguay, to Buenos Ayres, in Argentina: he is a truck driver and he has traveled that road countless times. But the journey he is about to make will be different: with him - who is usually always alone - this time there will be Jacinta, who arrives an hour late for the appointment where he has to load them: a bad start. Surprisingly, the girl also brought her 5-month-old baby with her. Rubén and Jacinta do not know each other, but they have 1500 kilometers ahead of them to pass together. And even if their journey will be of few words, it will not be silent.
notes: Caméra d'or at Cannes 2011, with us two years late and it is useless to ask why, the debut of the forty-five-year-old Argentine Pablo Giorgelli makes a virtue of modesty: in a flat style with a serene and painful phlegm, it simply tells of an encounter between souls resigned to their discontent, and it does so through the accumulation of details, details, tiny gestures and slow emotional shifts, in a speech totally focused on what the faces of the actors express, on the pauses, on the clumsy and withheld words, on that they don't say. Delicate minimalist road movie with a certain destination, a bit locked up in a nice theorem.

title: Tatsumi
description: Japan has just given up and rising from the devastation of World War II is not easy. The smell of the bombs is still alive, the resulting poverty and loneliness bring out fears, obsessions and states of human alienation that pervade the drawings of a ten-year-old boy who has always been fond of comics. What was initially a game to escape from the surrounding reality will become a work that, over the span of fifteen years, will transform the little one into the most famous author of gekiga (stories designed for an adult audience with dramatic themes and characterized by precise lines).
notes: Taken from the biography of the designer Tatsumi (A Drifting Life), the film is interspersed with five gekigas (Hell, Beloved Monkey, Just a Man, Occupied, Good-Bye) designed by him and considered cult.

title: Volcano
actors: Þorsteinn Bachmann, Þröstur Leó Gunnarsson, Benedikt Erlingsson, Margrét Helga Jóhannsdóttir, Katla M. Þorgeirsdóttir, Jóhann Sigurðarson, Auður Drauma Bachmann, Elma Lísa Gunnarsdóttir, Björn Karlsson, Theodór Júlíusson
description: Sixty-seven-year-old Hannes has recently retired. Without his job as a janitor, the man is forced to spend his days at home, with nothing to do and in the company of his wife, with whom he has had a worn-out relationship for years. Due to his solitary character, Hannes has long since lost almost all contact with friends and has broken ties with family members. But his entire existence is destined to be turned upside down when, following tragic events, the elderly person has to come to the aid of someone he loves.

title: Arirang
actors: Kim Ki-duk
description: In 2008 on the set of _Dream_, director Kim Ki-duk helplessly witnesses an accident that almost causes the death of an actress. The event marked him deeply and pushed him to take refuge in an abandoned house where he led a life without comfort, in contact with nature.
notes: An autobiographical work, shot in the form of a diary with a digital camera, which marks the return of Kim Ki-duk after three years of profound personal and professional crisis. An introspective, poignant and narcissistic journey in which the Korean director reflects on love, passions and hatred, on relationships on and off the set, but above all on his cinema. The cry of pain of an author who wants to go back to work.

title: Elena
actors: Andrey Smirnov, Nadezhda Markina, Elena Lyadova, Alexey Rozin
description: Elena and Vladimir, two elders in their second marriage, have conflicting relationships with their first bed children. The wife is obsessed with her son's demands for money, unable to provide for himself and the needs of the family he has created. The husband, on the other hand, has not seen his daughter for a long time due to old disagreements. A heart attack that hits Vladimir will cause the man to reconnect with the girl and decide to name her his heir. Elena, usually docile and submissive, hoped for that inheritance to fix her son and will have to find a new solution.

title: Les bien-aimés
actors: Ludivine Sagnier, Catherine Deneuve, Milos Forman, Louis Garrel, Chiara Mastroianni, Goldy Notay, Kenneth Collard, Gavin Brocker, Michel Delpech, Aicha Kossoko
description: During the 1960s, marked by freedom and the sexual revolution, Madeleine left the city of Paris to join her new husband Jaromil in Prague. Their relationship is destined to be short-lived: with the arrival of the Russian tanks, the two break up and the woman returns to her native France. Thirty years later, in the days marked by AIDS and the fear associated with the disease, a similar fate will befall Vera, Madeleine's daughter, who moved to London for the love of Henderson. This bond is also destined to be wrecked in a short time. The two women attach themselves to their strength to live in order not to be disheartened by events.

title: In Film Nist
description: Despite having become a democracy, Iran still has to take all the necessary steps to become a free country. The director Jafar Panahi is well aware of this, sentenced in 2010 to six years of imprisonment and twenty years of interdiction from the set for having denounced to the world, through his films, the horrors of the Tehran government. In the period in which he was awaiting the sentence, the director traced in this documentary the situation in which the entire Iranian cinema finds itself. To help him and to collect the testimony is the director Mojtaba Mirtahmas, previously assistant director of Panahi himself.

title: Paradies: Liebe
actors: Margarete Tiesel, Peter Kazungu, Inge Maux, Dunja Sowinetz, Helen Brugat, Gabriel Mwarua, Carlos Mkutano
description: The beaches of Kenya are known to European tourists for the possibility of having easy adventures with local young people, who sell them love in exchange for some money and a better chance of life. Fascinated by what she hears about, Teresa, a fifty-year-old Austrian, decides to treat herself to a heavenly vacation that, between the pleasures of the flesh and bitter disappointments, will bring her into close contact with several men.
notes: Seidl captures in the documentary as in fiction the crash of Western ideology, its myths and visions, on the sentimental tabula rasa of economic exchange, of the individual logic of enjoyment, of the obtuse fetishistic accumulation. Pornographic and humanist, at the same time: it does not embellish the obscene and looks at the state of man without hypocrisy. First chapter of a trilogy.

title: Black Butterflies
actors: Rutger Hauer, Carice van Houten, Liam Cunningham, Grant Swanby, Graham Clarke, Leon Clingman, Nicholas Pauling, Jennifer Steyn, Damon Berry, Candice D'Arcy
description: In 1960, in South Africa plagued by apartheid problems that cause continuous clashes between white and black people, the young Ingrid Jonkel finds an outlet by pouring out her most intimate thoughts on paper. Struggling with the unhappy romantic relationship she has with Jack Cope (Liam Cunningham) and with her stiff father (Rutger Hauer), minister of parliament and member of the censorship commission, Ingrid will change the destiny of her life by becoming an established poet. .

title: Ausente
actors: Alejandro Barbero, Antonella Costa, Javier De Pietro, Carlos Echevarría, Rocío Pavón
description: Sixteen-year-old Martin is secretly attracted to Sebastian, his school's swimming teacher, and does everything he can to violate his privacy and discover secret aspects, in order to get closer to his world and try to outsmart him. The right opportunity to try to shorten the distance comes when, due to an accident, Martin pretends to have injured his eye and asks the professor to accompany him to the emergency room. Discharged a couple of hours later, the student gets from Sebastian, who feels guilty about what happened, the opportunity to spend the night in his house. But, due to a sexual approach during sleep, going back to school will not be easy for both of us to manage.

title: Amour
actors: Isabelle Huppert, Jean-Louis Trintignant, William Shimell, Emmanuelle Riva, Rita Blanco, Laurent Capelluto
description: Georges (Jean-Louis Trintignant) and Anne (Emmanuelle Riva) are now in their eighties and, after a life spent teaching music, have retired, also satisfied with the career of their daughter Eva (Isabelle Huppert), a musician who lives abroad with his family. But the love that binds the two elderly spouses will be put to the test when Georges will have to deal with humiliation and physical degradation due to a semi-paralyzing stroke that will suddenly hit his wife Anne, forcing him to redefine the balance family members, both with his wife and daughter.
notes: Amour is, above all: a meager theatrical dimension, a stage / apartment, two gigantic performers (Jean-Louis Trintignant and Emmanuelle Riva) and a very high, secular and moral cinema. Who is, out of modesty, reticent about the causes, full of ellipses, but attentive to the effects, to the affections: what he does not say is revealed by the presence of the two actors, the exact design, in the silences and on the faces, of elusive feelings and paradoxical. There are the heroic awkwardness of life at the time of death here, the calm despair, the polite dismay, the necessary emptiness of words, the futile need for a past to be told and the profound need for physical proximity.

title: Kiseki
actors: Koki Maeda, Ohshirô Maeda, Ryôga Hayashi, Cara Uchida, Kanna Hashimoto, Rento Isobe, Hoshinosuke Yoshinaga, Hiroshi Abe, Yoshio Harada, Isao Hashizume
description: After their parents divorced, the little brothers Koichi and Ryunosuke were forced to separate: the first lives with his mother in the house of his eccentric grandparents, the second instead followed his musician father to a city on the other side of Japan. The only hope they have to return to live under the same roof is to reunite their family but the task is difficult and the two just have to rely on an ancient legend, which tells of how a wish can come true when whoever expresses it attends the first meeting between two trains. And, thus, the recent opening of a new railway section pushes them to organize a reckless journey that will lead them, alone, to the place where they can express their request.

title: Hahithalfut
actors: Rotem Keinan, Sharon Tal, Dov Navon, Shirili Deshe, Shiri Ashkenazi, Zvika Fishzon, Michael Kfir, Arie Mark
description: Having returned from work early, not finding anyone at home, a family man rediscovers the sweet feeling of being with no one around in the home, with the perception of finding himself in a world unknown to him or lived only as a child, when he imagined mysteries and hiding places around every corner. From that moment on, he will come up with everything to avoid being in the company of his wife and children, risking to permanently distance himself from his life and reality.

title: Transgression
actors: Michael Ironside, Maria Grazia Cucinotta, Jonathan Keltz, Carlos Bardem, Yon González, Ivana Miño, Fabio Fulco
description: Elena (Maria Grazia Cucinotta) and Matthew (Michael Ironside) represent the perfect couple for those who know them: they love each other, they live in a luxurious and modern home and, above all, they have no financial worries. However, they are forced to get back into the game and test their survival skills when, in the middle of the night, a group of thieves sneaks into their home, triggering a spiral of violence and revealed secrets that leads to an unexpected reversal of roles between victims. and executioners.

title: Nel nome del padre - Director's Cut
actors: Yves Beneyton, Renato Scarpa, Piero Vida, Aldo Sassi, Laura Betti, Marco Romizi, Amerigo Alberani, Gérard Boucaron, Edoardo Torricella, Tino Maestroni
description: On the occasion of the Golden Lion for Lifetime Achievement, awarded to him at the 68th edition of the Venice Film Festival, the director Marco Bellocchio reworked his 1973 masterpiece, with the aim of updating it and cleaning it from ideological burdens, presenting a well-cut version 20 minutes of the story of the rebel and indomitable Angelo (Yves Beneyton), locked up in a luxury boarding school for kicking and slapping his father.
notes: Shortened by the director after the preview at the New York Film Festival on October 12, 1971 from the original 115 minutes to the 107 minutes of the first public screening on September 7, 1972, Bellocchio has chosen to get his hands on an ambitious and complex film for the third time today. reduced to 83 minutes. The new assembly eliminates numerous moments that served to emphasize the cloistered dimension of the institute. Filmed in Rome at the former high school Massimo, In the name of the father, today even more than yesterday, is confirmed as politically unavoidable as well as a visionary masterpiece by Marco Bellocchio, one of our creators of the most daring and necessary film forms ever.

title: Saya-zamurai
actors: Takaaki Nomi, Sea Kumada, Itsuji Itao, Kazuo Takehara, Jun Kunimura, Masatoh Ibu, Tokio Emoto, Satoru Jitsunashi, Ryô, Rolly, Takumi Matsumoto, Motohiro Toriki
description: Kanjuro is tired of his samurai life and decides to abandon his weapons to run away with his little daughter Tae. Wanted as a deserter, he is captured by the samurai of another clan and brought before their extravagant lord. The latter, in fact, grants him the possibility of saving himself from doing harakiri if in the following month, through thirty different attempts, he manages to bring a smile back to the face of his son, depressed since his mother died.

title: L'art d'aimer
actors: Gaspard Ulliel, Judith Godrèche, François Cluzet, Élodie Navarre, Julie Depardieu, Frédérique Bel, Pascale Arbillot, Stanislas Merhar, Louis-Do de Lencquesaing, Laurent Stocker
notes: Choral comedy about the consequences of love within a group of friends.

title: Louise Wimmer
actors: Corinne Masiero, Jérôme Kircher, Anne Benoît, Marie Kremer, Jean-Marc Roulot
description: Louise Wimmer lived her entire life between ease, comfort and luxury, thanks to her husband's economic position. At the age of fifty, however, the sudden separation cancels all well-being and slowly she finds herself forced to give up everything around her, to find a job as a cleaning lady and to live in hardship inside her car. The only thing she has left is a healthy dose of pride, which leads her to want to rely only on her strength to succeed, refusing the help and support of her new and affectionate partner and daughter, even at the risk of be too hard and anchored to the sense of superiority given to it by the previous class of belonging.

title: Voi siete qui
actors: Alberto Crespi, Angelina Chavez
description: To write a book, the critic Alberto Crespi, followed by the photographer Angelina Chavez who moved to Italy for a couple of years, guides the city of Rome on a journey to discover the famous locations of Italian cinema, pausing in the places that dozens of directors have chosen as the set of their films, recounting their emotions and trying to imagine with the filmmakers what those scenes would have been like had they been shot today.

title: Une vie meilleure
actors: Guillaume Canet, Leïla Bekhti, Slimane Khettabi
description: Yann is a qualified chef from years of study but cannot find work in Paris restaurants due to a lack of practical experience in the sector. During yet another job interview, he meets Nadia, a single mother of Franco-Algerian origins, with whom he falls in love. Yann, Nadia and their son Slimane form a perfect family but, to pursue his dream, Yann takes a loan from a bank to buy an abandoned building near a lake and turn it into a restaurant, thus compromising both his economic situation and his his love life due to the impossibility of repaying the debt contracted, so much so that Nadia, accepting a job in Montreal, decides to leave, leaving him alone to grapple with Slimane's growth.

title: Himizu
actors: Shôta Sometani, Fumi Nikaidô, Tetsu Watanabe, Mitsuru Fukikoshi
description: The family life of the young Sumida is certainly not going very well. The mother first kicked her drunk father out of the house and then moved into her new partner's house, leaving her son alone and struggling with the worries of everyday life and the boat rental shop he runs. Subjected to great stress, Sumida has to deal with the cruelty and dark world of the demons of her mind, which little by little try to take over. The only person who tries to stay close to him is his classmate Keiko Chazawa looking for someone to love but the situation worsens when Sumida one evening on impulse kills her father, during yet another discussion made up of verbal and physical violence.
notes: Based on the manga of the same name by Minoru Furuya.

title: Mildred Pierce
actors: Kate Winslet, Guy Pearce, Evan Rachel Wood, Brian F. O'Byrne, Melissa Leo, James LeGros, Murphy Guyer, Mare Winningham, Marin Ireland, Diane Kagan, Miriam Shor
description: In Los Angeles, during the Great Depression, Mildred (Kate Winslet), a woman of humble origins with great courage and independence, faces the separation from her husband and the complicated relationship with her daughter Veda (Evan Rachel Wood), arrogant and narcissistic, towards which he nurtures an insane devotion. Surrounded by weak and indolent male figures, Mildred can only count on her own strength to seek social and personal redemption.
notes: 5-part television miniseries, based on the novel of the same name by James M. Cain.

title: Présumé coupable
actors: Philippe Torreton, Wladimir Yordanoff, Noémie Lvovsky, Raphaël Ferret, Michelle Goddet, Farida Ouchani, Olivier Claverie, Jean-Pierre Bagot, Sarah Lecarpentier, Vincent Nemeth
description: In Boulogne, at dawn on November 14, 2001, the police broke into the Marécaux's home and, without consideration for the small children present at the scene, resorted to strong means to arrest Alain and his wife, accused along with twelve other people of being involved in the Outreau case and having committed terrible acts of pedophilia. From that moment on, a long and inhumane judicial ordeal begins for Alain, who declared himself innocent right from the start, which forces him to four very long years in prison and which upsets his life as well as that of his family.
notes: Inspired by the true story of Alain Marécaux and based on the book he himself wrote to denounce one of the biggest mistakes of the French judicial system.

title: Siglo ng pagluluwal
actors: Angel Aquino, Joel Torre, Perry Dizon, Hazel Orencio, Roeder Camanag, Soliman Cruz, Dante Perez, Modesta
description: The director Homer has been working for years on the realization of his latest work: he has in mind a story that tells how the cult can be capable of destroying the world due to the fundamentalism of some exponents, as in the case of a Christian cult leader of an area rural area of ??the country. During the making of the film, Homer annihilates his muse and then re-evaluates her at the end of the work.

title: Inni
actors: Jon Thor Birgisson, Orri P. Dyrason, Georg Holm, Kjartan Sveinsson
description: Stock footage from Icelandic band Sigur Rós' first ten-year career alternate with filming the band's concert at London's Alexandra Palace, before taking a long break from the stage and seeing the original lineup reduced to just four components (after the abandonment of the Amiina string quartet).

title: Mundial Olvidado
description: In the history of football in the twentieth century there is a shadowy history that has ended up taking on the halo of legend: the World Cup held in 1942 in Patagonia, Argentina, and never recognized by the official bodies. For years not even the name of the winning team of the tournament was known, yet the event was often remembered by excellent testimonies. To find out what really happened, the directors Garzella and Macelloni go to South America to tell a story in which sporting passion is intertwined with the anarchist epic of those years of world history.
notes: Fake newsreels, fake vintage photographs, stickers of the participants, even the complicity of football's big hits: the film flows between legend and reality, without, however, completely clarifying its underlying motivations. In good faith, we believe that Garzella and Macelloni wanted to reflect on the ability of cinema to produce and objectify myths, transfiguring historical material (conflict, fascism, the World Cup) to elevate it to an epic status made up of love, patriotism and challenge to regimes. Also for this reason, feeling condescending sympathy for the film is an instinctive act.

title: Keyhole
actors: Jason Patric, Isabella Rossellini, Udo Kier, Kevin McDonald, Tattiawna Jones, David Wontner, Brooke Palsson, Darcy Fehr, Daniel Enright, Louis Negin
description: After a long absence, gangster Ulysses Pick (Jason Patric) returns home, dragging the body of a teenage girl and a bound and gagged young man with him. There, all the members of his gang who have managed to overcome the police forces await him. There is great friction between them, the shadow of betrayal hovers but Ulysses seems to focus his attention on one thing only: to reach, room after room, his wife Hyacinth (Isabella Rossellini), locked in her upstairs bedroom. The company, however, is more difficult than expected and every corner of the house hides unexpected events that take you back to the mysterious past of the family.

title: Nuit #1
actors: Catherine de Léan, Dimitri Storoge
description: Clara and Nikolai meet at a rave party and end up having sex at his house. During the night, Clara tries to sneak out of the house quietly but Nikolai wakes up and begins to criticize the choices of modern women so emancipated that they use men as tools. His words start a long conversation that lasts until dawn, allowing the two to get to know each other in depth and to bring out the ghosts of their past life experiences.

title: Into the Abyss
actors: Richard Lopez, Michael Perry, Damon Hall, Lisa Stotler-Balloun, Charles Richardson, Jason Burkett, Jared Talbert
description: In gathering testimony from death row inmates, director Werner Herzog comes across the story of Jason Burkett and Michael Perry, two young boys arrested in 2001 for triple murder and sentenced to life in prison one and the other to death, respectively. Rei of having killed with the aggravating circumstance of futile reasons - the theft of a car for a trip out of town -, they were nailed by irrefutable evidence against them, so much so that the jury's verdict did not admit excuses. After interviewing Perry and Burkett just eight days after the execution, in order to examine the dynamics related to the American judicial system, the director also meets the families of the victims, the perpetrators, the police officers and the law forces involved in the affair. .

title: Momo e no tegami
description: After the death of her father who left her an unfinished letter, Momo leaves Tokyo with her mother to move to the small island of Shio, where she immediately learns local habits and customs, thanks also to the friendship of some children. Soon, in what seemed like a peaceful place, strange episodes begin to occur and every time she is left alone in the house Momo hears mumbling coming from the attic. Researching the origin of those sounds, she meets a trio of annoying little devils from whom she learns that her arrival in Shio is somehow connected to the letter her father was writing to her before he died.

title: Amen
actors: Kim Ye-na, Kim Ki-duk
description: A Korean woman goes to France to visit her boyfriend but, having arrived at her destination, she discovers that he has left for Venice and thus decides to join him in Italy. On the way to Venice, however, she is attacked and raped by a stranger who wears a gas mask and steals all her luggage. Arriving in the Venetian city, she has another unwelcome surprise: her boyfriend has already left for a trip around Europe. Thus, she too begins to wander around the old continent, chased by the rapist who, little by little, begins to return her stolen luggage.

title: Poongsan
actors: Kye Sang Yoon, Gyu-ri Kim, Kim Jong-soo, Han Gi-Joong, Choi Moo-Seong, Ha-bok Yu, Yong-geun Bae, Jeong-seok Kim, Jo Jae-Ryong, Nak-jun Lee
description: Challenging fate and the police forces, Poongsan continually crosses the border line between the two Koreas to act as a courier of messages and information for all those who have family members who live on the other side of the country. One day, unexpectedly, Poonsan is approached by the South Korean secret services who assign him the task of going to North Korea to pick up the young In-oak, the lover of a deserter who has found refuge in Seoul. On the way back, however, the two fall in love going towards the Machiavellian revenge of the betrayed lover.
notes: Written and produced by Kim Ki-duk.

title: Noordzee, Texas
actors: Jelle Florizoone, Nina Marie Kortekaas, Eva van der Gucht, Mathias Vergels, Luk Wyns, Thomas Coumans, Katelijne Damen, Daniel Sikora
description: Towards the end of the 1960s, Pim is sixteen and lives in a remote village on the Belgian coast with her eccentric and plump mother Yvette, an accordion player who spends her time drinking, smoking and winning new boyfriends. From an early age, Pim dreamed of a better existence, imagining that one day he could become queen or princess of a beauty pageant, while now he begins to dream of living a love story with Gino, the neighbors' son who has become his idol. but also the cause of constant derision and humiliation by other peers. When his mother runs away with a young partner, Pim is left alone and to get closer to his dream he goes to live in the house of nearby Marcela not imagining that Sabrina, Gino's sister, has fallen in love with him.

title: Jesus Henry Christ
actors: Toni Collette, Michael Sheen, Jason Spevack, Samantha Weinstein, Frank Moore, Aaron Abrams, Melyssa Ade, Paul Braunstein, Hannah Brigden, Luca Castricone
description: Ten-year-old Henry wants to know why he grew up alone with his mother Patricia, a staunch feminist, without ever knowing her father and, while Patricia glosses over the answer, grandfather Stan tells him that he was conceived using the seed of an anonymous donor. Finally, he discovers that he is the son of university professor Slavkin O'Hara, the single father of Audrey, a twelve-year-old girl who is the subject of a book on raising children in a family formed by a homosexual couple written by Slavkin himself and therefore became the laughing stock of his peers. Due to a provocative manifesto he has drawn up, Henry is expelled from school but gets a scholarship as a child prodigy and can attend university, where he meets his father and sets out to form a single family.

title: Hasta la Vista!
actors: Robrecht Vanden Thoren, Gilles De Schrijver, Tom Audenaert, Isabelle de Hertogh, Kimke Desart, Johan Heldenbergh, Karlijn Sileghem, Karel Vingerhoets, Katelijne Verbeke, Marilou Mermans, Sebastian Sundback, Charlotte Timmers, Xandra Van Welden
description: Philip, Lars and Jozef are three Belgian friends in their twenties who, like most of their peers, love the good life, wine and women. However, while they have also drunk too much wine, they have never had the chance to lose their virginity in their lives and dream of the moment when that will happen. Eager to speed up time, with the excuse of visiting the vineyards, they plan a trip to Spain. There is only one small problem: each of them has a different handicap - one is blind, another is in a wheelchair and the third is completely paralyzed - and therefore they need the company of a nurse, happy to accompany them in the crazy adventure.
notes: Loosely based on the story of Asta Philpot, a handicapped American who has waged a long struggle to defend his sexual rights.

title: The Ballad of Genesis and Lady Jaye
country: United States, Germany, Great Britain, Netherlands, Belgium, France
actors: Genesis P-Orridge, Lady Jaye Breyer P'Orridge, Big Boy Breyer P'Orridge, Edley Odowd, David Max, Alice Genese, Markus Persson, Bryin Dall
description: Progenitor of electronic music and performative artist who has made transformation his winning card, Genesis P-Orridge has been involved since 2000 in the greatest of his works, dictated only by love: physically transforming, thanks to the use of plastic surgery, into Lady Jaye, his artistic and life partner, thus merging two spirits into one body. During the seven years served to the metamorphosis, Genesis is constantly followed by its 16 mm camera which does not spare to capture even the most unexpected and painful moments in the life of the performer, such as the death of Lady Jaye.

title: Ulidi piccola mia
actors: Paola Pugnetti, Giada Meraglia, Marcella Diena, Eleonora Deidda, Marco Romeo, Laura Polito, Stefano Bardi, Eleonora Rizzi, Giancarlo Pugnetti, Mina Bettache
description: Paola is about to turn eighteen and consequently has to leave the foster home where she spent the last four years of her life and return to her parents, a peasant father and a Muslim mother. In addition to having to face the difficulties linked to two cultural universes at the antipodes, Paola finds herself having to deal with a new phase of life and fully enter adulthood, leaving behind her adolescence and the sufferings suffered over the years. .
notes: Zoni, in his first feature film, is freely inspired by Escape from madness. Journey through Maria Zirilli's Basaglia Law and chooses the not easy but effective way of docufiction. The director's gaze is decisive but not invasive, it opens up on the fragility of the girls and approaches without false modesty the stories about the origins of their illness, depression and attacks of bad anger. Paola's promise becomes author's poetics: delicacy, in all its value, is safe.

title: American Masters: Woody Allen - A Documentary
actors: Woody Allen, Letty Aronson, Antonio Banderas, Marshall Brickman, Josh Brolin, Dick Cavett, Penélope Cruz, John Cusack, Larry David, Seth Green, Diane Keaton, Scarlett Johansson, Martin Landau, Sean Penn, Martin Scorsese, Mira Sorvino, Naomi Watts, Dianne Wiest, Owen Wilson
description: Beyond the subjective thought about his works or his busy private life, Woody Allen is certainly a legend of international cinema and for the first time ever someone is given the opportunity to follow him closely while he is at work on the set: from realization of You Will Meet the Man of Your Dreams Until the first public screening of Midnight in Paris, director Robert B. Weide stays with Woody Allen to document his creative genius. To frame it all, there are the interviews that Weide makes with Allen's friends, including the actors who have had the pleasure of being directed by him during his long career.
notes: Weide is very generous in showing the art and life of Allan Stewart Konigsberg - this is the real name of the filmmaker of Me and Annie - and shuns the corrosive and iconoclastic style. Instead, it portrays, with temporal and content constraints, the career of a man who does not shy away from any questions, not even those to which he replies with elusive irony. Patience if sometimes there seem to be chasms in half a century and more too condensed (it is no coincidence that the DVD version should be longer than two hours): his collaborators, actors and relatives are enough (the ex-wife, the ex-nanny , his sister), his images, his words, his jazz notes, his working habits. Because when a director opens his door, even if it is only ajar, it is a unique gift.

title: Le vere false teste di Modigliani
description: In July 1984, extraordinary news bounced around the world: three boys from Livorno found a head sculpted by Amedeo Modigliani in the ditch of the city of Livorno. All the critics agree in the attribution of the find, visitors, journalists and television crews come to Livorno to document the exceptional nature of the circumstance. Some time later, however, the three boys, including the artist Angelo Froglia, declare that it was a joke and that the head was nothing more than the fruit of their nocturnal creation, triggering an unprecedented uproar that risks undermine the assets of the art universe.

title: Keep the Lights On
actors: Thure Lindhardt, Zachary Booth, Julianne Nicholson, Souleymane Sy Savane, Paprika Steen, Maria Dizzia, Sebastian La Cause, Justin Reinsilber, Ed Vassallo, David Anzuelo
description: It was 1997 when, in New York, Erik, a documentary director, met for the first time Paul, a charming and introverted lawyer, involved in the publishing sector. What was supposed to be a very early evening meeting becomes something more. Erik and Paul fall in love and decide to try to build a single path together, by going to live in the same house. They dream of becoming one, of sharing every aspect and difficulty of life but, despite the good intentions, each of them continues to fight alone against their fears and addictions.
notes: Teddy Award at the 2012 Berlin Film Festival for best queer-themed feature film.

title: Chasing Ice
country: United States, Bolivia, Canada, France, Greenland, Iceland, Italy
actors: James Balog, Svavar Jonatansson, Adam LeWinter, Jeff Orlowski
description: In 2005, National Geographic entrusted photographer James Balog with the task of documenting the melting of glaciers in Iceland following the climate changes affecting the whole planet with images. Although skeptical, Balog sets out on a revealing journey that arouses in him the desire to face a more extreme challenge: to reach the North Pole and photograph the changes that with their consequences are destined to irreversibly change the structure of the Earth.
notes: He placed about thirty cameras near the largest glaciers in the world, and took photos every hour, for months, then for years. To oppose skepticism, look at what is happening: in time lapse, juxtaposed at speed, the photos are a horror film, a stop motion of the ice that thins, runs out and vanishes. Jeff Orlowski, making his debut in the feature film, does not hide the fascination for a stoically Herzogian character, but he does not touch his personal charisma or the message of ecological urgency: let the images speak, let us look.

title: L
actors: Aris Servetalis, Makis Papadimitriou, Eleftherios Matthaios, Nota Tserniafski, Stavros Raptis, Thanassis Dimou, Christoforos Skamnakis, Yannis Bostantzoglou
description: A man in his forties, who lives aboard his car, spends his free time meeting his ex-wife and two children at set days and times, always within car parking areas, while earning a living by doing from driver and escort to a mysterious fifty-year-old. One day, however, when another driver shows up at the door of the fifty-year-old and shoots him, killing him, he finds himself involved in a metropolitan war between cyclists and motorists and forced to flee because no one is willing to believe his truth.

title: Searching for Sugar Man
actors: Sixto Rodriguez
description: In the late 1960s, two famous record producers discover a young musician in a Detroit bar who, with his soulful melodies and intense prophetic lyrics, they believed would have a lot to say in the history of music. That musician was Sixto Rodriguez who, however, after a series of unsuccessful concerts and a couple of records that no one bought, disappeared into thin air. For years, many legends have tried to give answers to the possible end of the singer-songwriter, fearing often imaginative hypotheses, until one day in South Africa two fans make an exceptional discovery.
notes: Sixto publishes some records in the USA in the 70s that no one buys but surprisingly becomes a star in South Africa, so much so that Steve Biko is an admirer. And so Rodríguez, the son of a Mexican who grew up in the black slums of an industrial metropolis, becomes the inspirer of the anti-apartheid struggle. Hence the recherche of Stephen “Sugar” Segerman and Craig Bartholomew Strydom, the two fans, told by Bendjelloul with different formats but above all with such a contagious energy as to be able to make an incredibly exciting story infinitely exciting.

title: Death Row
description: Werner Herzog continues the project undertaken with Into the Abyss (2011) by entering the maximum security prisons in Texas to tell the stories of those on whose heads a death sentence hangs. Collecting the testimonies of those who proclaim themselves innocent and unjustly accused of the most abject crimes, the director takes the opportunity to focus attention on the judicial system of the United States, the only Western country to still retain a penalty that infringes every right of human beings. .

title: Marley
actors: Bob Marley
description: An icon of reggae music, Bob Marley continues to live thanks to the love and boundless admiration of fans from all over the world who, from Jamaica to Africa passing through America and Europe, keep the legend alive. Through a detailed reconstruction, the result of years of work, the director Kevin Macdonald reinterprets the myth, focusing attention on the philosophical and religious implications that the figure of Marley imposes.
notes: In balance between the artificial light of apology and the shadow of contradictions, Marley returns the passion and (at times) the calculation of a myth capable of making music for the globe and transforming the local (Jamaica) into a new frontier, speaking at the heart of the world with a daring, naive and universal mix of ethics, politics, religion, the sincere fruit of his intimate passion and, at the same time, a luxuriant marketing flower. Only at the end does the emotion free itself from precision.

title: Le voyage extraordinaire
actors: Costa-Gavras, Jean-Pierre Jeunet, Michel Gondry, Michel Hazanavicius, Nicolas Ricordel, Eric Lange, Tom Burton, Tom Hanks, Georges Méliès
description: In 1902 Georges Méliès made the first science fiction film in the history of cinema, The Journey to the Moon: the story of six university professors, members of an astronomy club, who flee from the moon after arriving there thanks to a rocket fired from a giant cannon and having discovered the existence of the Selenites. With the help of great directors and actors of the 21st century, Serge Bromberg and Eric Lange reconstruct the genesis of one of the first masterpieces in the history of cinema, investigating its weight in subsequent cinematography and following the complex restoration work to which the work went to meet for a new release in theaters.

title: American Translation
actors: Lizzie Brocheré, Pierre Perrier, Djédjé Apali, Jean-Marc Barr, Benjamin Bollen, Esteban Carvajal-Alegria, Laurent Delbecque, Frederic Eng, Ionita Radu Georgescu, Yamin Gougmar
description: The reckless Christophe lives as he pleases and does not like to give explanations on his behavior, even when they appear incomprehensible and violent. One evening, in a hotel, he meets the rich Aurore, a French-American girl, with whom he immediately creates a strong understanding that turns into love and passion. As the days go by, Aurore learns the dark sides of Christophe's character at his expense until the feeling he feels begins to creak and be a source of doubts and uncertainties after Christophe "accidentally" kills a call boy named for. cheer up their night of sex and excesses.

title: Tabu
actors: Teresa Madruga, Isabel Muñoz Cardoso, Ana Moreira, Laura Soveral, Carloto Cotta
description: An old lady with a strong temperament, her Cape Verdean caregiver and a neighbor who has always been involved in civil cases share the same landing in a Lisbon apartment building. On the death of the old woman, the other two learn of an episode from her past, linked to an intriguing story of love and crime that she had lived long ago in distant Africa, breaking all social convention.

title: Django Unchained
actors: Jamie Foxx, Christoph Waltz, Leonardo DiCaprio, Samuel L. Jackson, James Remar, Kerry Washington, Don Johnson, Franco Nero, Jonah Hill, Walton Goggins, Dennis Christopher, Dana Michelle Gourrier, Nichole Galicia, Laura Cayouette, Ato Essandoh, Miriam F. Glover, James Russo, Russ Tamblyn, Amber Tamblyn, Bruce Dern, M.C. Gainey, Danièle Watts, Zoe Bell, Michael Bowen, Robert Carradine, James Parks, Tom Savini, Michael Parks, Quentin Tarantino, Misty Upham
description: In the southern United States, two years before the Civil War, the black slave Django (Jamie Foxx) was able to regain his freedom thanks to King Schultz (Christoph Waltz), a former German dentist turned bounty hunter, who he mentors and guides with the hope that Django will lead him to the dangerous Brittle brothers. After learning to juggle guns and duels, Django in turn becomes an excellent bounty hunter but in his head he continues to have only one goal to materialize at any cost: to be able to track down his wife and free her from the slavery to which Calvin Candie forces her. (Leonardo DiCaprio), the diabolical owner of some plantations in Mississippi, where slaves are trained to fight against each other for the sheer amusement of their master.
notes: For Quentin, a bulimic devourer of pulp cinema and B-Movies, the time for the western could not fail to come. And here it is then, a western that has an important subtext, which only partially refers to the Italian tradition, but which bears the signature - always very recognizable - of its author. Success with critics and audiences, despite the open debate and some detractors.

title: The Story of Film: An Odyssey
description: Bringing the book of which he is the author to the big screen, Mark Cousins ??reinterprets the history of cinema from the dawn to the advent of digital, leveraging his experience as the host of a program on cinema for the BBC. With his individualistic approach, Cousins ??builds a reasoned itinerary in fifteen episodes that analyze in toto the global film production, thanks to the mixture of unpublished interviews with the greatest directors with film clips from all over the planet.
notes: In the year in which The Artist triumphs at the Oscars, a film that revives the history of cinema on the contrary, here is a wonderful Monopoly on cinema, full of chances and unexpected events, but where Parco della Vittoria is not always a masterpiece, maybe Vicolo Corto wins . Distributed by Bim in a homeopathic dosage of two episodes at a time, a safe antidepressant cure, Cousins' Odyssey in the cinematic space is a fantastic 900-minute journey devoid of any commonplace or banality. It starts with Private Ryan and ends with a Fellini's circle around the statue of the Film in Burkina Faso, to tell how directing is a lie to tell the truth, concluding that it is not money that guides the history of films, but the ideas that continually they renew themselves.

title: Laurence Anyways
actors: Melvil Poupaud, Karine Vanasse, Nathalie Baye, Monia Chokri, Yves Jacques, Catherine Bégin, Suzanne Clément, Guylaine Tremblay, Patricia Tulasne, Sophie Faucher
description: In 1989, while in a restaurant with his girlfriend Fred to celebrate his thirtieth birthday, Laurence informs her that she has chosen to change sex and become a woman, while expressing the intention to continue their relationship. After a period of hesitation, Fred agrees to stay with him and accompanies him on a difficult path that collides with the refusal of the boy's family, the stigmatization of society and the misunderstandings dictated by the different vision of the world they are preparing to live, done of lies, secrets and double games.

title: Rebelle
actors: Rachel Mwanza, Alain Lino Mic Eli Bastien, Serge Kanyinda, Mizinga Mwinga, Ralph Prosper, Jean Kabuya, Jupiter Bokondji, Starlette Mathata, Alex Herabo, Dole Malalou
description: In Congo, 14-year-old Komona tells her child she has in her womb the story of the last two years of her life, starting when she was just 12 years old and forced, after the loss of her family, to fight in the ranks of the army of rebel warriors. . Learning to handle heavy weapons such as Kalashnikovs and experiencing the shame of rape on her skin, Komona found consolation and affection thanks to the Magician, a fifteen-year-old with whom she dreams of freeing herself from the horrors of war and getting married.

title: Sseo-ni
actors: Ho-jeong Yu, Sim Eun-Kyeong, Hee-kyung Jin, Min-yeong Kim, Su-hee Go, Kang So-ra, Lee Yeon-Kyeong, Nam Bo-ra, Kim Seon-Kyeong, Bo-mi Kim
description: Na Mi is a woman in her forties imprisoned in her daily routine with a husband engaged only in his work and a daughter who does not seem to tolerate her. While in the hospital visiting his mother, he finds an old high school friend, Choon Hwa, who is terminally ill with cancer. Remembering times gone by is more than a game, from the early days when Na Mi with her strange dialect first arrived at her new school in Seoul to when they were both part of the Sunny group, seven close friends who together seemed could defeat the world. Choon Hwa's last wish as leader of the Sunny is to see them at work one last time. Comparing the lives of today with those of then may not be so pleasant. Especially when Choon Hwa is very close to death.

title: This Ain't California
description: A journey into the world of skaters in East Germany which is also the training story of three teenagers and their unconditional love for a sport whose practice, in the German Democratic Republic, was dangerous and charged with a rebellion that was at the same time playful and vital, punk and transgressive. The documentary follows the three boys starting from their childhood in the 70s and ending in 1989, when with the fall of the wall their life changed forever, but it does not fail to make us see them again in 2011 , to take stock of their path.

title: Arrugas
description: After showing the first signs of Alzheimer's disease, Emilio is taken to a nursing home for the elderly and immediately makes friends with Miguel, who has been hospitalized there for some time. Like all the other guests of the structure, Emilio also has the nightmare of ending up on the upper floor where, without the comfort and support of his companions, you can breathe the air of the real hospice. Thus he devises an extravagant plan that gives him new life and breaks the boredom that raged in the days of his new adventure companions.
notes: Nostalgia is the feeling that accompanies us by the hand in the rooms of "Rughe". Minimalist furniture, where the photo on the bedside table evokes a beach holiday and the window on the courtyard can become the porthole of the Orient Express. Far from rhetoric, Ferreras grants his little moments of negligible happiness to the knowledge of pain. With the sharp and poetic trait of Paco Roca's graphic novel, he marries animation to the struggle - (self) ironic and moving - for resignation. Because this surrender is an act of heroic awareness.

title: J'enrage de son absence
actors: William Hurt, Alexandra Lamy, Augustin Legrand, Norbert Rutili, Jalil Mehenni
description: After ten long years of absence, the fifty-year-old Jacques (William Hurt) Jacques settles in the cellar of Mado's house without his knowledge with the complicity of his son, entering his life like a bolt from the blue. Married and mother of Paul, a seven-year-old boy, Mado is suspicious of Jacques' true intentions when she notices that a strong relationship of empathy and complicity is being created between her newfound lover and her son that risks cutting her off. So, despite the presence of her husband, Mado asks Jacques to move to the basement of his home so that he can control his movements and be as close as possible when he meets Paul.

title: Hiver nomade
description: Carole and Pascal are heading to French-speaking Switzerland with their herd of 800 sheep, 3 donkeys and 4 dogs. They sleep in the open, wash themselves in the streams and on their road, covered with snow and ice, they meet the local populations, some friends to stop by for a few hours and some enemies who do not allow their sheep to pass over their pastures. Theirs is an ancient work that is forced to adapt to the surrounding environment in constant evolution and aimed at progress.

title: La demora
actors: Carlos Vallarino, Roxana Blanco, Oscar Pernas, Cecilia Baranda, Julieta Gentile, Facundo Segovia, Thiago Segovia
description: Maria, a forty-year-old mother already overwhelmed by the care she has to give to her three children, is forced to turn to the social security office to prove that she is too poor to also provide for elderly father Agustin, suffering from senile dementia and brought back home. from a friend after an escape attempt to reenter his old home. However, she discovers that she is still considered too rich to have access to the benefits provided by the law and that she has to find a solution on her own.

title: L'attentat
actors: Ali Suliman, Evgenia Dodena, Reymond Amsalem, Uri Gavriel, Dvir Benedek, Ruba Salameh, Karim Saleh, Ramzi Makdessi, Vladimir Friedman, Ezra Dagan
description: Amin Jaafari is an Israeli-Palestinian surgeon, now fully integrated in the city of Tel Aviv and happily married to Sihem. He has a glittering career ahead of him when a suicide bombing in a city restaurant kills 19 people and the police inform him that his wife is responsible. At first incredulous, Amin rejects any accusation but the discovery of a letter written by Sihem before his death leaves no room for doubt. Destroyed by the revelation, he leaves Tel Aviv and, in search of answers to his thousand questions, he enters the Palestinian territories, where he immediately realizes that he is not welcome.
notes: Adaptation of the novel of the same name by Yasmina Khadra.

title: Madangeul Naon Amtak
description: Leafie, a hen who grew up on a chicken farm, dreams of one day being able to escape and roam free in the countryside. When the opportunity presents itself to escape, she takes advantage of it but is immediately hunted by One Eye, the most terrible of weasels. Saved by the duck Wanderer, Leafie will be grateful to him for life so much that, when his companion is killed by One Eye, she takes care of their only egg in the nest. The night the egg hatches, Wanderer also dies under the blows of the weasel and Leafie has nothing left but to grow up little Greenie like her son.
notes: More than a fairy tale about the importance of feelings above diversity, the film is the epic tale of the harassment suffered by Leafie: a tireless heroine devoted to sacrifice according to a classically oriental scheme. If his vicissitudes with the duckling are of no interest to any viewer over the age of 8, his extreme gesture (which overturns the happy ending in a harrowing ending for an animated film of this genre) is indigestible for most. small: it is difficult to imagine which audience it can address.

title: A Glimpse Inside the Mind of Charles Swan III
actors: Charlie Sheen, Mary Elizabeth Winstead, Bill Murray, Patricia Arquette, Jason Schwartzman, Aubrey Plaza, Katheryn Winnick, Richard Edson, Maxine Bahns, Bar Paly
description: Charles Swan III has everything a man could want. A successful graphic designer with a strong attraction to women, at the age of 45 he thinks he has found his half of the apple in Ivana. So when she suddenly ends their relationship, Charlie's life falls apart and he finds himself enveloped in a spiral of doubt and confusion. Through delusional fantasies involving his failed relationships, Charlie begins an arduous journey of self-evaluation to come to terms with a life without Ivana.

title: Ha-Sippur Shel Yossi
actors: Ohad Knoller, Lior Ashkenazi, Oz Zehavi, Orly Silbersatz Banai, Ola Schur
description: Yossi, a homosexual from Tel Aviv lives a lonely and withdrawn existence. Perpetually sad, he only thinks about his job when his peaceful world is turned upside down by the visit to his doctor's office of a middle-aged woman, back out of her past. Yossi is so upset that the decision to leave the city matures. In southern Israel, however, the fortuitous encounter with a group of lively soldiers awakens Yossi from the emotional numbness in which he has forced himself for years.
notes: Sequel to Yossi and Jagger (2002).

title: Eddie: The Sleepwalking Cannibal
actors: Thure Lindhardt, Dylan Smith, Georgina Reilly, Alain Goulem, Stephen McHattie, Peter Michael Dillon, Paul Braunstein, Corey Charron, Karl Claude, Alexis Maitland
description: Lars, a young artist, finds himself in the midst of a creative crisis. His artistic vein led him to cross the line of common good taste and the use of animal blood and entrails led him to a chasm from which he wishes to escape. Unable to find the right inspiration, he agrees to teach briefly at an art school in a small Canadian town, where he immediately becomes interested in Eddie, a strange and clumsy student. Eddie, however, suffers from a rare form of sleepwalking that turns him into a ferocious cannibal at night. Once Eddie's secret is discovered, Lars' creativity is rekindled, even at the cost of sacrificing many innocent human lives.

title: Memoria de mis putas tristes
actors: Emilio Echevarria, Geraldine Chaplin, Angela Molina, Olivia Molina, Paola Medina, Dominika Paleta, Alejandra Barros
description: An elderly journalist (Emilio Echevarría), a critic of a Caribbean newspaper, lived a lifetime as a bachelor. As a child he idealized his mother so much that, after her death, he was no longer able to attach himself emotionally to any woman. To satisfy his impulses, since the age of 12 he has used the services of some prostitutes and for his 90th birthday he wants to treat himself to a special night with a young virgin. He thus turns to Rosa Carbagas (Geraldine Chaplin), owner of a brothel he used to visit as a young man, and she directs him to a twenty-year-old still pure (Paola Medina), thanks to whom he will discover love, jealousy, hatred and profound disappointments.
notes: Adaptation of the novel of the same name by Gabriel Garcia Marquez.

title: In me non c'è che futuro. Ritratto di Adriano Olivetti
actors: Mirella Mastronardi
description: Characterized by strong local roots and futuristic social policies, Olivetti's business model has promoted an alternative model of society.
notes: Fasano, a pupil of Tonino Guerra, uses archival films and photos to retrace the surprising parable of an atypical multinational.

title: Jagten
actors: Mads Mikkelsen, Thomas Bo Larsen, Annika Wedderkopp, Lasse Fogelstrøm, Susse Wold, Anne Louise Hassing, Alexandra Rapaport, Lars Ranthe, Ole Dupont
description: After a difficult divorce, 40-year-old Lucas has a new girlfriend, a new job and is fixing his complicated relationship with his teenage son Marcus. But suddenly things turn for the worse. A lie begins to spread like an invisible virus in the community where he lives. In shock, Lucas finds himself accused of pedophilia, a crime he did not commit, and, overwhelmed by a kind of collective hysteria, he must fight a bitter battle to regain his life and dignity.
notes: The strength of the film, what grabs the viewer by the collar, is precisely the life of that character who, in a film that is not at all consoling, where in every scene there is a nuance capable of demonstrating the malevolent ambivalence of the appearance of any thing, it continues to hold in place a kind of humanist heroism for which no violent reaction can be a solution to anything. There is something equally disturbing in the piety he has, and at the same time adorable. As shown in the final scene, in which he reunites with the girl who accused him unfairly, a scene capable of making even a 50-year-old critic, insensitive and atheist, cry at Cannes 2012.

title: V Tumane
actors: Vladimir Svirskiy, Vladislav Abashin, Sergei Kolesov, Nikita Peremotovs, Yulia Peresild, Kirill Petrov, Dmitrijs Kolosovs, Stepans Bogdanovs, Dmitry Bykovskiy, Vlad Ivanov, Igor Khripunov, Nadezhda Markina, Boris Kamorzin, Mikhail Evlanov, Sergey Russkin, Timofey Tribuntsev
description: 1942. Nazi troops occupied the western region of Russia. Burov and Voitik, two Soviet partisans, go to take Sushenya, a railway employee first arrested by the Germans and then released. Sushenya, who has never even trusted his wife, denies having collaborated with his enemies and, since no one gives credit to his words, follows the two partisans with the hope of being able to prove his innocence and save himself from their thirst for revenge. . When they are ambushed while crossing the forest, Sushenya is called upon to make a moral choice, which calls into question the concepts of betrayal and heroism.
notes: The long sequence shots in the trees, the opaque colors of the 35mm photograph by Oleg Mutu (the same operator as Cristian Mungiu) or some images full of pity and suffering, such as that of the prisoner carrying his executioner on his shoulder, Souls in the fog a sad and universal war story, able to restore dignity to the victims of history and to grasp their torments and fragility, before the fog of time dissolves them.

title: Aquí y Allá
actors: Teresa Ramírez Aguirre, Pedro De los Santos, Lorena Guadalupe Pantaleón Vázquez, Heidi Laura Solano Espinoza, Néstor Tepetate Medina, Carolina Prado Ángel, Noel Payno Vendíz, Nicolás Parra Quiroz, Copa Kings, Jorge De los Santos
description: After working for years in the United States, Pedro returns to the small mountain village of Guerrero in Mexico, where he meets his wife and two daughters now grown up and distant from him. With his work he has saved up some money with which he hopes to set up a gang but, in the meantime, he takes advantage of the annual harvest to work in the fields. Among the locals, accustomed to a life of economic insecurity and letting their closest family members go across the border, Pedro meets a young teenager in the camps, who dreams of leaving for the United States and to whom he acts as a mentor.
notes: Esparza frames the expectation and complications of birth without dwelling on the event, because the event in his film is the very flow of existence, divided into chapters that do not break the documentary approach: delicate and tenacious, poetic and political, animated by the unequivocal desire to look "inside" the border. "Here and there" but above all in the middle of a man split: between an inhabited place, rooted in affections and in dimly lit interior corners, and an obligatory toll, returned as the intangible but looming specter of a recent, potentially infinite past . Grand Prix of the Semaine de la Critique 2012.

title: La Sirga
actors: Joghis Arias, Julio César Roble, David Guacas, Heraldo Romero, Floralba Achicanoy
description: Alicia cannot get out of the eyes the images of the war he has lived on his own skin. Only and lost, she decides to go far from the places that recall her the terrible memories of her and she decides to manage the Sigra, a dilapidated pension on the banks of a small lagoon among the high mountains of the Andes. The pension, however, belongs to his only family member, the elderly and lonely Oscar, with whom he has the opportunity to clash several times. When Alice seems to buy light -heartedness and serenity, the shadow of a new war manifests himself on the horizon bringing fear and terror in his life.

title: Les chevaux de dieu
description: Tarek is 10 when Morocco is trying to leave the years of lead behind. With a depressed father, a brother in the army and an almost autistic brother, his mother Yemma and brother Hamid, a neighborhood bully who soon ends up in jail, take care of the family. Once back at liberty, to leave poverty and misery behind, Hamid convinces Tarek and his friends to join the group of Islamic radicals that he too has become a part of. Together they will follow the directions of Imam Abu Zubair, who elevates them to the rank of martyrs for an attack in Casablanca.
notes: Adaptation of the novel Les Etoiles de Sidi Moumen by Mahi Binebine.

title: Final cut - Hölgyeim és uraim
actors: Brigitte Bardot, Alain Delon, Bruno Ganz, Greta Garbo, Rita Hayworth, Karady Katalin, András Kozák, Tony Leung Chiu Wai, Giulietta Masina, Marcello Mastroianni
description: Through a series of images taken from the great classics of world cinema, the last great love story between the definitive model of a perfect man and woman is reconstructed, mixing distinctive traits of characters told by the big screen. He is charming like Marcello Mastroianni in La dolce vita, tough like Brad Pitt in Fight Club, adolescent like Leonardo Di Caprio in Titanic or Alain Deon in Rocco and his brothers, decided like Sean Connery or David Craig in 007, melancholy like Tony Leung in The Mood for Love, devastating like Clark Gable, enigmatic like Gary Oldman in Dracula, funny like Woody Allen in Me and Annie or clumsy like Charlie Chaplin in Modern Times. Instead, she is unpredictable like Gina Lollobrigida, graceful like Audrey Hepburn, childlike like Audrey Tatou, cold like Greta Garbo, divine like Sophia Loren, funny like Julia Roberts, sensual like Monica Bellucci, ethereal like Liv Tyler and kissing like Kim Novak.

title: Diamond Flash
actors: Ángela Boix, Miguel Insua, Klaus, Rocío León, Eva Llorach, Victoria Radonic, Ángela Villar
description: Violeta is willing to do anything in order to find her missing baby. Elena hides a strange secret. Lola wants nothing but close the accounts with his past. Juana needs someone who loves her unconditionally. Enriqueta is constantly looking for those who can make it laugh. These five women, distant from each other, have something in common: they are all linked to Diamond Flash, a mysterious character who will change their lives forever.

title: Un consiglio a Dio
actors: Vinicio Marchioni, Ilaria Dervishllari, Kiswendsida Judicael Ouango, Prasath Jayasinghe Appu, Johnson Ransford, Liana Nesta, Issam Abdi
description: At night, along a coast made of dirt and excrement, a man (Vinicio Marchioni) retrieves the bodies of immigrants who had been shipwrecked along the Italian coast. His life as an Italian outcast is integrated with that of migrants fleeing wars and misery, in a remote dialogue constructed through the use of interviews conducted with illegal immigrants welcomed in the first reception centers and then gradually inserted into the Italian social context.
notes: Dionisio relies on the documentary, making use of frontal contributions in which immigrants tell stories of difficulties and abuses, but also and above all of life and hope. There is no hypocritical pity in his work, and not even the easy and abused attack on the country (of origin, of arrival) because what matters is the sea, that territory of travel in which the destinies of migrants are decided. The real empathy with which the director tackles the human question of immigration goes beyond sinister politics, touching on populism and then avoiding it with a profound gap. Based on the play "Il trovacadaveri" by Davide Morganti.

title: Ba-bi
actors: Kim Ah-Ron, Sae-ron Kim, Cheon-hee Lee, Cat Tebo, Yong-seok Jo, Earl Jackson
description: Thirteen-year-old Barbie arrives together with his father Steve, an American doctor, in Pohang to adopt the thirteen-year-old Soon-Young, who lives together with his father, mentally fragile, and to the sister Soon-Ja. Soon-Young is not willing to accept a new family: she is uncle of her mang-tak to push her to her Steve of her to get rich in her. However, adoption hides a sad truth. Steve plans to use Soon-Young for a heart transplant, useful to save the life of the youngest daughter suffering from a heart malformation. While between Barbie and Soon-Young begins to create a strong friendship relationship, the little Soon-Ja tries to do everything in order to replace the sister and be she to crown the personal dream of going to America.

title: Paradies: Glaube
actors: Maria Hofstätter, Nabil Saleh, Natalija Baranova, René Rupnik, Dieter Masur, Trude Masur
description: Anna Maria is a staunch Catholic. Devoted to Jesus Christ and his example, while her sister Teresa left for Kenya, she dedicates her holidays to a singular pilgrimage. In the hope that all of Austria can be led back to more virtuous paths, Anna Maria goes from house to house every day with one of her 40 cm statuettes depicting the Virgin Mary so that everyone can adore her. After years of absence, however, her husband, an Egyptian Muslim, confined to a wheelchair, returns home. From that moment on, the chants and prayers alternate with a hard daily struggle.
notes: Anna Maria is a metaphor for a nation and its burning contradictions. But it is also a challenge launched by Seidl to the viewer: it causes him to feel superior, judging by the narrow horizon of the protagonist. The Seidl trilogy is about this: the daily tribute of lies, self-absolution and masochism that everyone offers, in a socially acceptable exchange of goods, to grab their own paradise. Second chapter of the trilogy that began with Paradise: Love (2012) and ended with Paradise: Hope (2012).

title: Bumchoiwaui junjaeng
actors: Min-sik Choi, Jung-woo Ha
description: A corrupt police officer who is about to be discovered and hunted sells a batch of heroin found by chance during a search in a shipping container to the most powerful gangster in Busan. Over time, their partnership becomes a friendship linked to the interests of the various criminal trafficking. When the police declare war on the Busan gangs, this strange friendship begins to falter.

title: Okami kodomo no ame to yuki
description: Ame and Yuki are two children, brother and sister, who live peacefully with their mum Hana and dad in an uncrowded area of ??the city. Theirs is a joyful and peaceful existence but one that hides a secret that no stranger knows: the dad, whom Hana met when she was a 19-year-old student, is a werewolf, a wolfwere. When he suddenly dies, Hana decides to leave the city and move to a small village nestled in a lush forest, an ideal place to raise children away from prying eyes. Like their father, Ame and Yuki are also little werewolves and Hana is willing to protect them from any surrounding danger.
notes: The theme of the return to nature is addressed by Hosoda, flanked by the character designer of "Neon Genesis Evangelion" Yoshiyuki Sadamoto, in a key where the supernatural is well anchored to a reality that is also crude and the main tone is that of melo. Not everything works perfectly, because this seriousness of purpose makes the sweetened description of hard work in the fields and small rural communities at times cloying. On the other hand, the quality of the animation is impeccable and many sequences are touching, moreover a question of principle arouses benevolence: that this work arrives, even for just one day, on our screens is a victory towards a more open and international culture. .

title: La fille de nulle part
actors: Jean-Claude Brisseau, Virginie Legeay
description: Michel, a lonely mathematics professor who has retired and in the throes of loneliness, saves Dora, a mysterious homeless man, from a dangerous situation. The presence of the young woman inside his apartment fascinates the professor but quickly becomes the cause of the occurrence of strange events, such as the sudden movement of objects without any rational explanation: phenomena behind which a disconcerting truth is hidden.

title: The Weight
actors: Cho Jae-hyun, Zia
description: Jung is the mortuary's undertaker. Born hunchbacked and left as a child in an orphanage, Jung is seriously ill with tuberculosis and acute arthritis but the disease does not prevent him from taking care of the corpses, dressing them and preparing them for their journey to the afterlife. His is a noble work that daily leads him to be the last living being who silently meets the dead, in a mixture of reality and fantasy in which lifeless bodies are transformed into friends and models for the compositions that he defines works. of art. Adopted as a child by a woman who treated him like a slave, over time he developed an obsession with his adoptive brother who later became a woman. For her, he is intent on preparing his final masterpiece, a final gift that highlights his hate and love.

title: A Liar's Autobiography - The Untrue Story of Monty Python's Graham Chapman
directors: Bill Jones, Jeff Simpson, Ben Timlett
actors: Graham Chapman, Terry Gilliam, John Cleese, Michael Palin, Terry Jones, Carol Cleveland, Philip Bulcock, André Jacquemin
description: 17 different animation styles, all made in 3D by 15 different studios, tell the life of Graham Chapman, a member of Monty Python who died in 1989 at the age of 48 from throat cancer. From childhood to the fundamental meeting with John Cleese, passing through success and problems related to one's sexuality and alcohol, each episode is adapted from the autobiography - partly true and partly fictional - that Chapman himself published in 1980. To give voice to the characters of Monty Python are the four still living members of the English comedy group (John Cleese, Terry Gilliam, Terry Jones and Michael Palin) while for the dubbing of Chapman a reading of the autobiography recorded by himself just before he died.

title: Much Ado About Nothing
actors: Amy Acker, Alexis Denisof, Nathan Fillion, Jillian Morgese, Clark Gregg, Fran Kranz, Reed Diamond, Spencer Treat Clark, Riki Lindhome, Ashley Johnson, Sean Maher
description: Filmed in great secrecy by Joss Whedon during breaks in shooting The Avengers, the film's only known is that it is a modern reinterpretation of William Shakespeare's play Much Ado About Nothing, in which two of the most unlikely couples in the world - Beatrice (Amy Acker) and Benedick (Alexis Denisof), Claudio (Fran Kranz) and Hero (Jillian Morgese), with different positions on romance and the value of words - find themselves confronted with very dangerous enemies and security guards with disreputable methods. .

title: Ja tozhe hochu
actors: Yrii Matveev, Alexander Mosin, Oleg Garkusha, Alisa Shitikova
description: In the summer, a black SUV whizzes through the desert roads. There are four people on board: Bandit, his closest friend with his old father and his beautiful girlfriend. They are headed for the Bell Tower of Happiness, which is said to be between St. Petersburg and Uglich, near the area where a now decommissioned nuclear power plant stands. The bell tower, which helps people disappear, however, does not fulfill everyone's wishes and each of them wants their request to come true.

title: Harry Dean Stanton: Partly Fiction
actors: Harry Dean Stanton, David Lynch, Wim Wenders, Sam Shepard, Kris Kristofferson, Debbie Harry
description: Harry Dean Stanton, iconic actor, talks about himself through some intimate moments, footage taken from his films and his own heartbreaking interpretations of some American folk songs. Alternating the use of color with black and white, the film explores the actor's enigmatic perspectives on life, displays his untapped talent as a musician and includes candid scenes with David Lynch, Wim Wenders, Sam Shepard, Kris Kristofferson and Debbie. Harry.

title: Jagal
description: A group of Indonesian repentants, former members of the death squads, are invited to reconstruct the crimes they committed by staging them in the style of the American films they love so much. The result is a surreal cinematic journey that delves into the memories and fantasies of the material perpetrators of some of the most heinous genocides in the history of a country where those who kill are considered a hero and corruption and violence reign unpunished.
notes: Using an unhinging device - between Rithy Panh and Errol Morris, under the moral attitude of a Herzog (which, with Morris, he produces) - the director invites the slaughterers to stage the ancient deeds, making them play torturers and tortured in improvised films: the American noirs or Bollywood musicals with which they want to represent, images of the stories with which they are handed down, revelations of the obscene fiction of which they are protagonists and the ideological dimension of an aberration that for years has organized the imagination of a nation. And what now is there, naked, ridiculous, shameful, in front of them and our eyes.

title: Mea Maxima Culpa: Silence in the House of God
actors: Alex Gibney, Jamey Sheridan, Chris Cooper, Ethan Hawke, John Slattery, Brady Bryson, Larry Hunt
description: Oscar-winning director Alex Gibney reconstructs the drama of sexual abuse committed by senior Catholic figures in the United States. While public opinion is shocked by the number of cases brought to light and the lives of the abused children are forever marked, Gibney follows a path of investigation that from the homes of Milwaukee passes through the choirs of Irish churches to reach the upper echelons of the Vatican.
notes: Alex Gibney, the creator of the documentary, is someone who likes to see clearly. It is no coincidence that he is now working on Lance Armstrong: The Road Back. The timely testimonies are in contrast to the painful confessions of the victims. In a gruesome diary of perversions and mistreatment, silence and silence in the house of God. Documentary with dutiful and painful demands.

title: San Zimei
description: Three little sisters - Ying (10), Zhen (6) and Fen (4) - live alone in a small village in the high mountains of the Yunnan region of China. The father works downstream, hundreds of kilometers away, and the mother left them a long time ago. Not going to school, the three girls spend their days working in the fields or wandering the streets of the village.
