Armed with patience, Ying takes care of the two sisters, works hard and sometimes helps her grandfather and aunt in exchange for a meal. One day, however, the father returns home and decides to take his two youngest daughters with him, leaving Ying under the supervision of his grandfather and at the mercy of an even more solitary life.

title: Días de pesca
actors: Alejandro Awada, Victoria Almeida, Oscar Ayala, Diego Caballero, Daniel Keller, Martín Galindez, Santiago Sorin, Heriberto Ruiz Díaz, Sandra Ximena Hoyos, Kharold García
description: Marco Tucci (Alejandro Awada), a traveling salesman from Buenos Aires and a middle-aged alcoholic, decides to change his life after a stay in a detox center. His advisor suggests he find a hobby and Marco opts for fishing, planning a trip to Puerto Deseado during the shark fishing season. Between unexpected encounters and moments of reflection, Marco's true intentions begin to reveal themselves: the journey actually hides the desire to reunite with his daughter Ana (Victoria Almeida), who settled in the nearby city of Jaramillo with her husband Josè and their son Gianni just born. Relations between father and daughter have long been non-existent and Ana has no intention of overcoming the wounds of the past, showing herself hard and reticent to any attempt at contact.

title: Bejbi Blues
actors: Magdalena Berus, Nikodem Rozbicki, Klaudia Bulka, Michal Trzeciakowski, Magdalena Boczarska, Renata Dancewicz, Katarzyna Figura, Jan Frycz, Mateusz Kosciukiewicz, Danuta Stenka
description: Natalia is a seventeen year old girl who lives at home with her mother and little son Antos. Despite her young age, Natalia wanted to become a mother on purpose because she believed it was the coolest thing to do to have someone to love and to be loved unconditionally. Everything in her life changes when her mother decides to leave her life, leaving Natalia struggling with everyday problems and a "normal" life.
notes: Crystal Bear at the Berlin Film Festival 2013.

title: Mad Max: Fury Road
actors: Tom Hardy, Charlize Theron, Nicholas Hoult, Hugh Keays-Byrne, Nathan Jones, Zoë Kravitz, Riley Keough, Rosie Huntington-Whiteley, Abbey Lee, Courtney Eaton, Richard Norton, Josh Helman, Jennifer Hagan, iOTA, Megan Gale
description: Max Rockatansky (Tom Hardy), better known as Mad Max, finds himself involved with a group of people fleeing the wilderness of Australia in the drilling war waged by Imperatora Furiosa (Charlize Theron). Thus a conflict originates that on the streets will leave behind a trail of victims and few survivors able to tell what happened.
notes: George Miller repeats the miracle of Interceptor - The warrior of the road, that of a neorealism action with kamikaze stunt, more pyrotechnic than digital effects, the director and his gaze in the trenches for a minimized artificiality. The final chase with the ferocious men attached to the poles is amazing. Mad Max: Fury Road is the anti-videogame, it is the journey of the heroes in a fantastic land called cinema.

title: To agori troei to fagito tou pouliou
actors: Yiannis Papadopoulos, Lila Mpaklesi, Vangelis Kommatas, Kharálampos Goyós, Konstadinos Voudouris
description: Yorgos, an educated boy but estranged from family and friends, has as his only company that of his cheerful canary. Unemployed, penniless and evicted from the dilapidated apartment he lived in, Yorgos only pursues one goal: to feed himself. Wandering through the streets of the city with his canary on his shoulder and rummaging through the waste bins, he has no qualms in his endless search for food: he steals from an elderly neighbor, loots the dead and shares the food with his canary so as not to ask anyone for help.

title: Avant l'hiver
actors: Daniel Auteuil, Kristin Scott Thomas, Leïla Bekhti, Richard Berry
description: Paul (Daniel Auteuil) never questioned his choices. Married to Lucie (Kristin Scott Thomas), who abandoned her career to pursue his aspirations as a neurosurgeon, Paul has always been loyal to her, has earned the respect of colleagues, raised a child with her and has a beautiful home. . Having reached maturity, the meeting with the young Lou (Leïla Bekhti) subverts his world. When he receives roses every day both at home and at work, Paul suspects Lou is stalking him but can't help but be fascinated by his grace, emotional frailty, and air of mystery.
notes: Philippe Claudel, novelist in his third direction, dances on the border between drama and mystery, sets the film inside Paul's mind - a man who, for work, opens heads and fixes them, but by his own admission does not know what there is. inside - and turns his emotions into twists. Forcing the viewer to embrace the hypothesis that those feelings are more important than the truth.

title: Kid
actors: Bent Simons, Maarten Meeusen, Gabriela Carrizo, Rit Ghoos, Sander van Sweevelt, René Jacobs
description: Kid (Bent Simmons), a small child, lives together with his mother (Gabriela Carizzo) and his brother Billy (Maarten Meeusen), a little older than him, on a farm at the gates of a small town. From the moment the father abandoned the family, the three had to look after themselves and they did to go on but their finances are in ruins. Destiny causes the two brothers to move to live in the home of the uncle and aunt and Kid, missing the mother more than ever, wishes to return with her again.

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
actors: Leonardo DiCaprio, Jonah Hill, Margot Robbie, Matthew McConaughey, Kyle Chandler, Rob Reiner, Jean Dujardin, Jon Bernthal, Jon Favreau, Ethan Suplee, Jake Hoffman, Katarina Cas, Joanna Lumley, Kenneth Choi
description: Jordan Belfort (Leonardo Di Caprio) by day manages to earn thousands of dollars a minute that with the same speed he squanders on drugs, sex and travel around the world. Going from selling ice cream to being the head of a stockbroker office, Jordan is greedy, he loves power and all forms of excess. While conducting his business with somewhat questionable methods, he experiences a stormy relationship with his wife (Margot Robbie) with whom he has two children until, in the 1990s, his insatiable appetite, debauchery and partnership with shoe designer Steve Madden (Jake Hoffman) throw his name in the mud.
notes: Adaptation of the homonymous novel by Jordan Belfort, screenplay by Terence Winter (Boardwalk Empire), directed by Martin Scorsese. The result of this alchemy is a glittering film, 100% pure Scorsese, a model that is unsurpassable but to which it irresistibly approaches because this thing here, edited in this way here, can only be done by the director of "Goodfellas". Without the moral alibi of crime, the addiction of the "wolf of Wall Street" ends up affecting us all because wealth and greed create a contagious and intoxicating addiction. Among the moments of absolute cinema, the long part of the phone calls under hallucinogen, with coca instead of spinach (Popeye the Sailor Man).

title: Smrt coveka na Balkanu
actors: Emir Hadzihafizbegovic, Radoslav Milenkovic, Natasa Ninkovic, Ljubomir Bandovic, Branislav Trifunovic, Bojan Zirovic, Aleksandar Djurica, Anita Mancic, Milica Mihajlovic, Milos Samolov
description: A lonely composer commits suicide in his Belgrade apartment. Alarmed by the gunshots, Aca and the neighbor Vesko rush in but decide to wait for the police to arrive. Gradually, as the agents are stuck in traffic, a diverse range of characters appear on the scene, from gravediggers to paramedics, who in blind indifference struggle to remember the composer's name or admire his décor.
notes: Inspired by a real experience of the director, the film is shot with a fixed frame through the narrative device of the images provided by a webcam installed in the dead man's house.

title: Good Vibrations
actors: Richard Dormer, Jodie Whittaker, Dylan Moran, Mark Ryder, Andrew Simpson, Adrian Dunbar, Demetri Goritsas, Kerr Logan, Niall Wright, Paul Caddell
description: Terry Hooley is a radical and rebellious music lover who lived in Belfast in the seventies during the time of the bloody turmoil. When all of her friends begin to take sides and embrace weapons, Terri reacts by opening a record shop in one of the most bombed areas in Europe and calls it Good Vibrations. Thanks to the shop, Terry comes into contact with the nascent punk scene of the city, formed by a group of young musicians who cultivate the dream of bringing the city back to life.

title: Puhdistus
actors: Laura Birn, Liisi Tandefelt, Amanda Pilke, Peter Franzén, Krista Kosonen, Tommi Korpela, Kristjan Sarv, Jarmo Mäkinen, Jaanika Arum, Tomi Salmela
description: Aliide, who experienced the mistakes of the Stalin era and the deportation of Estonians to Siberia, finds herself dealing with her sense of guilt resulting from some opportunist choices and from a manslaughter. One night in 1992 in the courtyard of her house, Aliide finds Zara, a young woman who has just escaped from the clutches of the Russian mafia who held her as a sex slave. In a climate of mutual suspicion, the two women begin to reveal the reasons behind their every gesture, revealing a family tragedy full of rivalry, lust and shortcomings.

title: Una pistola en cada mano
actors: Jordi Mollà, Ricardo Darín, Eduardo Noriega, Luis Tosar, Leonor Watling, Leonardo Sbaraglia, Javier Cámara, Candela Peña, Eduard Fernández, Alberto San Juan
description: An ironic and emotional portrait of the shortcomings, weaknesses and other "virtues" of contemporary man. The stories of eight protagonists in their forties, confused and looking for a new identity, intertwine by chance in the wake of their sentimental misadventures. J. fights depression, despite his life being perfect. E., on the other hand, has been sleeping all the time since he returned to live with his mother. S. wishes to return with his ex-wife Elena and decides to face her. G. tries to understand why his wife is cheating on him. P. plans to seduce colleague Mamen. Two men see their wives swap roles so that they discover each other's secrets.

title: Liv & Ingmar
actors: Ingmar Bergman, Liv Ullmann
description: Liv Ullmann and Ingmar Bergman met in 1964, forming one of the greatest couples in the history of cinema. Together they lived for five years, had a baby and made 12 films. Almost fifty years later, despite Bergman is now dead, their love is still alive and to tell it from Bergman's house in Faro, Sweden, is Liv Ullmann in interviews that tell the private and working aspects of the director. The words are echoed by scenes from their films, which show how their personal relationship also inspired work on set and in front of the camera.

title: Dead Man's Burden
actors: Barlow Jacobs, Clare Bowen, David Call, Joseph Lyle Taylor, Richard Riehle, Jerry Clarke, Adam O'Byrne, Travis Hammer, Luce Rains, William Sterchi
description: 1870. In the areas near the New Mexico border, the scars of the American Civil War are still open and Martha, who has lost her father, together with her husband Heck decides to leave misery and destruction and move to San Francisco in search of new life. But before they sell the family ranch to a mining company, Wade, Martha's older brother, believed to have died in the war, reappears. With his return, old secrets slowly come to light that increase tensions between brother and sister, threatening what's left of the family.

title: Mundo Invisível
directors: Wim Wenders, Theo Anghelopoulos, Atom Egoyan, Manoel de Oliveira, Guy Maddin, Marco Bechis, Gian Vittorio Baldi, Laís Bodanzky, Maria De Medeiros, Jerzy Stuhr, Beto Brant, Cisco Vasquez
actors: Jupiter Apple, Ricardo Trêpa, Sonia Braga, Gian Vittorio Baldi, Leon Cakoff, Monja Coen, Thalma de Freitas, Denise Fraga, Laura Neiva, Thomas Oliveira, Mauricio Paroni
description: Through the making of 11 short films, a group of renowned and legendary directors of different origins - the Portuguese Manoel de Oliveira, the Polish Jerzy Stuhr, the Canadian Guy Maddin, the Italian Gian Vittorio Baldi, the Chilean but of Italian origins Marco Bechis, the German Wim Wenders, the Portuguese Maria De Medeiros, the Greek Theo Angelopoulos, the Canadian but of Armenian origin Atom Egoyan, the Brazilians Lais Bodanzky, Beto Brant and Cisco Vasques - present their "point of view" on the theme of invisibility in the contemporary world.

title: Still Life
actors: Eddie Marsan, Joanne Froggatt, Karen Drury, Andrew Buchan, Neil D'Souza, David Show Parker, Michael Elkin, Ciaran McIntyre, Tim Potter
description: Meticulous and organized to the point of obsession, John May (Eddie Marsan) is a municipal worker tasked with tracking down the closest relative of those who died in complete solitude, getting into the details of their lives. When the department he works for is cut down, John must strive to complete his latest case, embarking on a liberating journey that will eventually allow him to begin living his life to the full.
notes: Pasolini works in subtraction, with a minimal and restrained staging as much as the feelings of his protagonist: Eddie Marsan, eternal character actor, always capitalized in minor roles, takes care of the rest, who here gives his tiny man a gigantic interpretation. In the role of a character who speaks little and never raises his voice, each raised eyebrow, each contracted lip become the precise punctuation of a silent speech and draw an endless interior landscape. A very black fable that walks lightly arm in arm with death, "Still Life" is a bitter reflection (softened, perhaps too much, only by the final shot) on the place we occupy in the world and what we will occupy underground.

title: Shade and Light
description: Photographer Sebastião Salgado is the latest explorer to discover the world not yet touched by modern civilization. Accompanied by his son Juliano, Salgado ventures into pristine places while answering his son's questions about his work, which has become a way of life and has kept him away from his family. Although the relationship between father and son is uncertain and tense, both will gradually rediscover the strong bond that binds them as they discover an ancestral state of nature, full of mythical creatures and isolated human communities. From the heart of the Amazon River to Indian tribes, passing by Wrangel Island in Siberia and showing the Papoos of Irian Jaya and the lush swamps of the Pantanal in Brazil, Salgado is faced with people who appear to come from an alien planet, finding in between to them its ideal size.
notes: Following the chronological rigor of the artist's travels across continents, the documentary story adopts three points of view attested by as many narrating voices: the subjective one, entrusted to Salgado himself; the internal one, returned by his eldest son Juliano Ribeiro; the external one, taken over by Wenders and a camera that takes a step backwards for the benefit of photography and the human portrait of the Brazilian artist, now superimposed on the front of his creation, now captured in the presence of the latter as in a dialogue, now inserted in a painting that, from motionless, comes to life in the vertiginous overlap between photographic and film medium.

title: Un matrimonio
actors: Micaela Ramazzotti, Flavio Parenti, Christian De Sica, Andrea Roncato, Katia Ricciarelli, Eliana Miglio, Andrea Montovoli, Valeria Fabrizi, Edoardo Pesce, Gisella Sofio, Francesco Brandi, Alessandro Sperduti, Marta Iagatti, Isabella Aldovini, Maximilian Dirr, Mariella Valentini, Andrea Santonastaso, Ettore Bassi, Chiara Ricci, Giorgio Borghetti, Jacopo Bicocchi, Roberta Mengozzi, Claudia Salerno, Lucia Loffredo, Viola Sartoretto, Matteo Leoni, Chiara Basile Fasolo, Antonella Ferrari, Silvia De Grandi, Patrizio Pelizzi
description: The long love story between Carlo Dagnini (Flavio Parenti) and Francesca Osti (Micaela Ramazzotti) takes place against the backdrop of the chronicles of Italy from the second post-war period to 2005. Despite the different classes they belong to - he the son of a wealthy merchant (Christian De Sica) and she of a former immigrant and womanizer Arsenal worker (Andrea Roncato) -, since the first meeting in 1948 the two are destined to love each other for the whole life: they will marry, they will first become parents and then grandparents, overcoming crises and disappointments.
notes: Six-part television drama, made for Rai.

title: Jacky au royaume des filles
actors: Charlotte Gainsbourg, Vincent Lacoste, Michel Hazanavicius, Laure Marsac, Didier Bourdon, Noémie Lvovsky, Valérie Bonneton, Anémone, William Lebghil, Anthony Sonigo, India Hair
description: In the democratic and popular republic of Bubunne women hold power and decide wars while men wear the veil and take care of the houses. Jacky is a twenty -year -old who has the same imagination as all the bachelor of her country: marry the column, the daughter of the General, and have many daughters with her. However, when Generally organizes a party to find a husband to his daughter, things for Jacky will get hurt: mistreated by his in -laws, he will see his dream vanish gradually.

title: One Life
description: An extraordinary journey into nature, made in 4 years and with 10 thousand hours of filming, celebrates the most brilliant and imaginative stories of survival in the animal world. Through the entire life cycle of a new generation, the search for food and shelter, the dangers faced and the creation of new families are followed, revealing how evolution has guaranteed weapons for survival over the years.
notes: In the setting of breathtaking scenarios from the five continents, the directors insert micro-stories of unusual animals, linked by the (feeble) conducting threads of life given and survival made of food research and countermeasures to climatic adversities. Komodo dragons, lawn ants, pebble toads, shrews and other exotic creatures give life to short segments of a collective work, returned with HD Macro cameras and in sequences photographed in super high speed, then slowed down up to 80 times.

title: Yi Wu Si Er
actors: Adrien Brody, Tim Robbins, Chen Daoming, Fan Xu, Alec Su, Alfred Hsing, Hanyu Zhang, Yihong Duan, Xuejian Li, Mo Zhang
description: In 1942 the province of Henan experienced one of the darkest and most critical moments in the history of China. In the midst of World War II, with the population already pressured by threats from the Japanese military forces, a severe food famine caused by various factors hit the area, leading to the death of over 3 million people. People are starting to move to Shaanxi province. During the walk, the landowner Fan, along with his sixteen-year-old daughter Xing Xing, faithful servant Shuang Zhu and his tenant farmer Hua Zhi, meet three different men: the American journalist Theodor White (Adrien Brody) who has arrived to investigate the reasons for the famine, the chef turned judge Old Ma and Father Simeone, who is losing his faith in God and who turns to the Italian priest Thomas Megan (Tim Robbins).

title: L'ultimo pastore
actors: Renato Zucchelli, Piero Lombardi, Lucia Zucchelli, Patrizia Frisole, Hedy Krissane, Barbara Sorrentini
description: Forty-year-old Renato Zucchelli is the last remaining shepherd in the Milan area. He spends the summer with his sheep in the Bergamo valleys and returns to the outskirts of the Lombard capital to spend the winter. Renato has only one big dream: to reach the city center and bring his flock to the children of the city, to whom he can transmit his idea of ??freedom. The opportunity to transform the dream into reality is manifested thanks to the explicit request of an elementary school.
notes: To the road of the epic are added the panoramic paths of ethics: thoughts and words of Renato, philosophical gems to humiliate politicians, family portraits, an archaic language lesson, economic considerations, the praise of (this) resistant madness, characters secondary to scream, an invisible dog. All this in a simple cinema, which knows that the docu is a fiction and composes paintings like a sweetened, amiably cartoonistic Seidl, which winks at the western and the sitcom and smiles happy with its transhumance, in images that do not look at Pelešjan, but know making sincere pleasure awkward slow motion video clips from ugly local TVs. Precious.

title: Poirot: The Clocks
actors: David Suchet, Olivia Grant, Anna Skellern, Tom Burke
description: A police lieutenant runs into a woman, Sheila Webb, who runs out of a house. Inside, the body of a man is found surrounded by four clocks all stopped at the same time. The woman proclaims herself innocent and Inspector Poirot is tasked with solving the case.

title: Nebraska
actors: Bruce Dern, Will Forte, June Squibb, Stacy Keach, Bob Odenkirk, Devin Ratray, Rance Howard, Angela McEwan, Tim Driscoll, Mary Louise Wilson, Geindora Stitt, Elizabeth Moore, Kevin Kunkel, Missy Doty, Melinda Simonsen
description: Woody Grant (Bruce Dern), a short-tempered old man who has turned everyone away from his life, is convinced he's won a million dollars in a magazine sweepstakes. To claim the award, his son David (Will Forte) reluctantly agrees to accompany him from Billings, where they live, to Lincoln, Nebraska. As they travel through the streets of the United States, they will stop at the places that have marked Woody's life. Between recriminations, meetings with the rest of the family and with an old business partner, father and son will learn to know each other and to put aside the hostilities accumulated over the years.
notes: Slumped and precise like Dern's walk, the film captures with great attention what remains of a province once firmly working-class, now forgotten by the financial crisis. In a role that could have been Spencer Tracy, Ben Johnson or Harry Carey Jr., Dern offers a lesson in "American cinema" at its best. Payne with "Nebraska", an essential and flawless work like a song by Howe Gelb, precise in timing and attentive to the composition of space, finds an expressive happiness that had always escaped him until now.

title: Halley
actors: Alberto Trujillo, Hugo Albores, Luly Trueba
description: Alberto is dead and can no longer hide it. Her sad state of decay is becoming more and more evident and the make-up or perfume she uses to hide the signs of death is useless. So he decides to give up his job and let death take its course but not without first forming a strange friendship with Luly, the one who manages the gym where Alberto served as a night watchman.

title: Samsara
description: Pictures from various parts of the world show people and cultures of the planet. With the only commentary of a hypnotic soundtrack, the colorful visual kaleidoscope ranges from the mountains to African children playing, from Buddhist monks in prayer to the pyramids of Egypt, from St. Peter's Basilica to the crowds praying in Mecca, in a path which stages birth and death, tradition and modernity, faith and hope, struggle and forgiveness.
notes: Made in 5 years, in 25 different nations of the world, Samsara is an experience that caresses meditation and reaches immersion at times, transporting us on a multisensory journey that hinges on the sight and envelops the images - enchanting or gruesome - in a music that exceeds the size of the comment. However, the film does not cross the boundaries of the poster: enchanting or gruesome, it is a careful selection of portions of the existing. Returned beautifully but programmatically, proceeding by rightness and its opposites, by accumulation of scraps of our (in) civilization and harmonious details of remote corners of the planet. Men and robots look into the camera showing the same awareness of their role, also spectators of an elegant work-warning.

title: Dirty Wars
country: United States, Afghanistan, Iraq, Kenya, Somalia, Yemen
actors: Jeremy Scahill
description: Jeremy Scahill, investigative journalist and author of the best-selling Blackwater, plumbs the heart of America's secret wars. From Afghanistan to Yemen, passing through Somalia and beyond, Scahill goes to the most remote corners of the planet to show, with the help of interviews and testimonies, the effects that conflicts have both on American military forces and on victims of violence sometimes unheard of. The documentary also becomes an opportunity to trace the rise of the Joint Special Operations Command, one of the most secretive combat units in the United States Army.

title: God Loves Uganda
description: In East Africa an evangelization campaign is underway to change African religious culture with the grafting of some values ??imported from the right wing of American Christians. American and Ugandan religious leaders are jointly engaged in combating sexual immorality and missionary groups try to persuade Ugandans to strictly follow biblical law.

title: W imie...
actors: Andrzej Chyra, Mateusz Kosciukiewicz, Lukasz Simlat, Maja Ostaszewska, Tomasz Schuchardt, Maria Maj, Olgierd Lukaszewicz, Kamil Adamowicz, Mateusz Gajko
description: Father Adam brings to life a small parish in the middle of nowhere, setting up a social center for children with a difficult past behind them. His energy and dedication to the priestly mission make him well liked by the locals and everyone wants to have him next to him. After meeting a young local pariah, Father Adam is forced to confront the weight of passion and a long-forgotten dark secret. When the villagers' worst suspicions become certainties, Father Adam will become the enemy to fight.

title: Le dernier des injustes
actors: Claude Lanzmann, Benjamin Murmelstein
description: During the Second World War, Nazi propaganda led the public to believe that Theresienstadt was a model ghetto for Jewish settlement when in fact it was the last step before the gas chamber. Benjamin Murmelstein, the last president of the Jewish Council of Theresienstadt condemned in exile, from 1938 until the end of the war was forced to negotiate day after day with Eichmann. Despite being the one who knew Eichmann more than anyone else, Murmelstein was never called to testify during the trial against one of the most terrible Nazi executioners. Director Lanzmann met Murmelstein in Rome in 1976 for a long conversation and for the first time he is showing his images.
notes: Claude Lanzmann - author of the extraordinary "Shoah" - reduces the archive images to a minimum. Instead, there are the ruins, the deportation sites, the tracks of the Terezín station, the corridors and stairs that the old filmmaker re-crosses, with difficulty and obstinacy, while adding new pieces to the puzzle of history. The film is long, at times you get lost in dates, names, details, but the meeting with Murmelstein is one that you never forget, just as the figure of Lanzmann who crosses the concrete, living space of memory remains impressed.

title: Jiro Dreams of Sushi
actors: Jiro Ono, Yoshikazu Ono
description: In the basement of a Tokyo building, 85-year-old sushi master Jiro Ono works at his world-famous restaurant, Sukiyabashi Jiro. With Jiro on the brink of farewell to his profession but still pursuing his goal of crafting the perfect sushi, son Yoshikazu faces pressure to take over the reins of the family business and legendary restaurant. .
notes: The best segments of the film by the young New Yorker David Gelb are those dedicated to Jiro's team at work, the choice of materials and the creation of a sublime dish in its apparent simplicity. The documentary then delves into the stories of the chef's two sons: the eldest, relegated to his father's eternal second, and the younger, himself boss of a branch (less starred) of his father's restaurant. Portrayed in the shadow of a legendary parent devoted only to sushi, they become the protagonists of an almost mélo sector, directed by Gelb with impertinent (and not always in tune with) sadistic irony.

title: Happy People: A Year in the Taiga
actors: Werner Herzog
description: Siberia stretches from the Urals to the Pacific Ocean and is one and a half times the size of the United States but most of the 38 million inhabitants live only in the prosperous southern areas. In the heart of the central desert, in the deep taiga and far from any form of civilization, 300 indigenous people continue to live in the small village of Bakhtia near the Yenisei river, whose routine is marked by cultural traditions that have been handed down for centuries.

title: Epizoda u zivotu beraca zeljeza
actors: Senada Alimanovic, Nazif Mujic, Semsa Mujic, Sandra Mujic
description: The 31-year-old Senada lives in the Roma community of Poljica, in the Bosnian municipality of Lukavac, with her two daughters and her partner Nazif, who barely feeds the family with his work as an iron collector. About five months pregnant, as she has no health insurance, Senada never goes to the doctor to check her health until the day she starts bleeding. After being taken to hospital the next day, Senada learns from the doctor that she had an abortion and that she needs emergency surgery to remove the dead fetus. Since it is necessary to pay 500 euros, with no health insurance and no money available, Senada returns home but in the next ten days Nazif will do everything possible to save her life.
notes: Grand Jury Prize and Silver Bear for Best Actor (Nazif Mujic) at the 2013 Berlin Film Festival.

title: Pardé
actors: Kambuzia Partovi, Maryam Moghadam, Jafar Panahi, Hadi Saeedi, Azadh Torabi, Agha Olia, Zeynab Khanum
description: In a house by the sea the curtains are closed and the windows darkened. Inside the house there is a man with a dog, an animal considered unclean by Islamic law. The man is a director and is writing a screenplay when suddenly a mysterious young woman appears, fleeing the police for taking part in an illegal party on the shores of the Caspian Sea. Much to the director's chagrin, the woman refuses to leave. Who are the two really? Can they really be considered two outlaws? At dawn, another arrival will clarify their identity better.
notes: Silver Bear for the screenplay at the 2013 Berlin Film Festival.

title: Metamorphosen
description: The Southern Urals area is one of the places in the world most contaminated by radioactivity. Numerous accidents at the Mayak nuclear plant have made the area inaccessible for nearly sixty years, repeatedly contaminating the surrounding regions and their inhabitants. In the middle of nowhere between Europe and Asia, along the very polluted Tetscha River, people are struggling to live and survive.

title: I aionia epistrofi tou Antoni Paraskeua
actors: Christos Stergioglou, Maria Kallimani, Giorgos Souxes, Theodora Tzimou, Syllas Tzoumerkas, Lena Giaka, Vasilis Dimitroulias
description: Antonis arrives at a deserted luxury hotel by the sea. It is winter and while it wanders in vain its "disappearance" makes headlines in newspapers and television. For twenty years, Antonis has been the host of a popular morning show on a major television channel and knows he will soon have to put an end to his charade and reappear. He dreams of a comeback in style but is not ready to do so yet. Perhaps his non-return is the only way to preserve his personal "immortality".

title: Marius
actors: Raphaël Personnaz, Daniel Auteuil, Victoire Belezy, Jean-Pierre Darroussin, Nicolas Vaude, Daniel Russo, Marie-Anne Chazel
description: In the old port of Marseille, César runs a bar with his son Marius, who dreams to board one of the ships go out there and leave for distant lands. Always Marius, never admit it, is in love with Fanny, the young and beautiful woman selling shells secretly reciprocates his feelings. To prevent Marius put his signature and sets sail on an exploration ship, Fanny reveals her love and light up the jealousy of the sailor Panisse that although older, the long courting. Despite the call of the sea is strong, Marius decides to give up his plans to marry Fanny but shortly before the wedding something unexpected upset his future wife and César.
notes: Adaptation of the play of the same name by Marcel Pagnol, already brought to the cinema with Marius (1931) by Alexander Korda.

title: 31 gradi Kelvin
actors: Vincenzo Albanese, Antonio Ciurca, Silvia Francese, Omar Noto, Silvia Vena, Walid Gasmi, Filippo Luna, Elisa Di Dio, Doriana La Fauci, Aldo Terzo
description: After the death of his wife, Pietro, a thirty -year -old worker from the Fiat of Termini Imerese, faces the challenge with the disease alone. Ibrahim, Moroccan emigrated for years in Italy, hopes sooner or later to return to his country. Rachele is perpetually divided between work, of which he needs to live, and the desire to continue his university studies that has been forced to interrupt. Eva, a young painter, must adapt to factory work. Mariano and Luca, two skids without work, parents and some certainty, will come to a predictable terminus. Their stories of solitudes overlap and intertwine against the background of a society that has lost all root and value and of which they are victims and executioners at the same time.

title: Mi manca Riva. Viaggio di un collezionista di figurine
actors: Angelo Orlando, Massimiliano Bruno
description: When he was ten, Angelo lost his Mexico '70 football cards album, just given to him by his father, in the game. From that moment on, he swore to himself to buy it back and complete it all. His obsessive research continues over the years and to be able to carry out his dream he needs only one figurine: that of his idol Gigi Riva.
notes: Fifty years of history and customs of Italy told through the stickers of Panini footballers.

title: Sto lyko
actors: Giorgos Katsaros, Ilias Katsaros, Spiridoula Katsarou, Adam Paxnis, Kiki Paxni
description: In the mountains of western Greece, between the squalid and crumbling houses and the rocky valleys marked by two electric pylons and shrouded in fog, a group of shepherds discuss how to spend their last euros on beer and cigarettes, how to pay off their debts and on how to find new lenders, lamenting the desperate situation in which they live. Although they are the main source of livelihood, animals are the ones that bear the most signs of frustration from their owners.

title: White Epilepsy
actors: Hélène Rocheteau, Jean-Nicolas Dafflon, Anja Röttgerkamp, Dominique Dupuy
description: In the heart of a forest, two naked bodies move slowly out of total darkness. They are the ghosts of a man and a woman who perform a slow and horrible choreography, almost a ritual of domination and submission. When the male ghost tries to back off and retreat, the woman doesn't let go and throws herself on him.

title: Milius
actors: John Milius, Steven Spielberg, George Lucas, Harrison Ford, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Francis Ford Coppola, Robert Zemeckis, Martin Scorsese, Ethan Milius, Amanda Milius, Randal Kleiser
description: The life of John Milius, one of the most influential and controversial directors in the history of American cinema, is traced from the years in which Milius aspired to join the army until his definitive departure from Hollywood due to his radical beliefs and his controversial behavior. . Moving on to the time Milius was studying at USC Film School and the legendary work done in films such as Apocalypse Now, Jaws, Conan the Barbarian, Inspector Callaghan: The Scorpio Case Is Yours and Red Dawn, the documentary includes interviews with Milius himself. and other prominent names such as Steven Spielberg, George Lucas, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Francis Ford Coppola, Harrson Ford, Michael Mann, Robert Zemeckis and Oliver Stone.

title: La Vénus à la fourrure
actors: Emmanuelle Seigner, Mathieu Amalric
description: Playwright Thomas (Mathieu Amalric) intends to stage a play inspired by a text by Sacher Masoch but, after a long day of auditions, he cannot find the actress to entrust the role of the protagonist. Convinced that she is perfect for the part, Vanda (Emmanuelle Seigner), one of the aspiring protagonists who, with her vulgar and bizarre being, represents everything Thomas hates, comes to him by surprise and tries to show him that no one else is as suitable as she is. . During the audition, Vanda will demonstrate that she perfectly knows the text of the work and the attraction that Thomas will develop towards it will soon turn into an obsession.
notes: After the dress rehearsal with the elegant but linear "Carnage", Polanski folds further into those territories so dear to the sinister and ferocious game of intimacy, places of perverse (self) lesionist outlet in which to forget for a few hours the emptiness of "Il pianist ", the falls of" Oliver Twist ", the incompleteness of" The man in the shadows ". "Venus in fur" is the work of actors, of fields / counter-fields, of dialogues to be repeated ad nauseam in film schools, of filmed interiors as in the good old days of "Repulsion" and "Cul-de-sac". The author rediscovers and renews the nature of creative ecstasy as a linguistic guide and gives life to the most complex, layered and enlightened work of his last 30 years.

title: Prisoners
actors: Hugh Jackman, Jake Gyllenhaal, Maria Bello, Terrence Howard, Viola Davis, Melissa Leo, Paul Dano, Mike Gassaway, Jane McNeill, Dylan Minnette
description: Keller Dover (Hugh Jackman) finds himself facing the worst nightmare that can happen to a father: Anna, the six-year-old daughter, has disappeared along with her friend Joy. As the hours go by, detective Loki's (Jake Gyllenhaal) investigations focus on the old car parked near Anna's house and from it goes back to her driver, a certain Alex Jones (Paul Dano). As there is no evidence to hold Alex under arrest, Loki is forced to release him. Knowing that his daughter's life is at stake, the increasingly desperate Keller decides to try everything in order to find the girls.
notes: If many characters in "Prisoners" are prisoners in the literal sense, all are prisoners in a metaphorical sense, forced to act alone and trapped by a cruel fate. Leaden like the atmosphere photographed by the great Roger Deakins, who offers some masterful nocturnal sequences between rain and snow. A film with a labyrinthine plot that, like Villeneuve's previous film, yields a little in the end to an excessive desire to make it work. However, it is the only flaw of a thriller that, supported by a flawless cast, develops on multiple levels of interpretation without ever losing tension.

title: Soshite chichi ni naru
actors: Masaharu Fukuyama, Machiko Ono, Yoko Maki, Lily Franky, Jun Kunimura, Shogen Hwang, Keita Ninomiya, Isao Natsuyagi, Kirin Kiki, Jun Fubuki, Megumi Morisaki
description: One day Ryota, a man who has earned everything he has through hard work, and his wife Midori receive an unexpected call from the hospital where their son Keita was born six years earlier. They are amazed to learn that there was an exchange of babies at the time and that Keita is not their natural child. From that moment, Ryota is forced to deal with a decision that could change his existence forever: choosing between the son he raised as such and the one who belongs to him by nature. He will thus begin to question himself and the kind of father he was.
notes: Koreeda, with the courteous gaze of the Ozu and Yamada cinema, faces a "topos" of the comedy of misunderstandings, introduces stereotypes and schematisms, but development does not seek spectacle: it melts melodrama and comedy in the sea of ??truth. Because if you cry, if you laugh, you do it by associating with the characters, looking at them with understanding. The slow understanding of mistakes, sacrifices, helplessness. And their opposites. Koreeda's is cinema of limpid realism, deeply humanist. The placid surface of his shots is not interested in notable events, but in the ripples of reality, the small waves that carry inner turmoil.

title: Lulu, femme nue
actors: Karin Viard, Bouli Lanners, Corinne Masiero, Claude Gensac, Pascal Demolon, Philippe Rebbot
description: After a bad job interview, Lulu leaves home, leaving her husband and three children behind. Her adventure leads her to have three fundamental encounters: with an ex-prisoner protected by her brothers, with an elderly woman who is bored to death and with an employee harassed by her boss. Symbols of surprising love, the comfort of feminine intimacy and misinterpreted compassion, the three encounters will help Lulu find herself first and foremost.

title: Kaze tachinu
description: Report of the life of Jiro Horikoshi, the Japanese designer famous for designing the Mitsubishi A6M Zero fighter planes used by his country during the attack on Pearl Harbor in World War II.
notes: The artistic testament of Miyazaki, who for the sixth and (apparently) last time announced his retirement, is the unresolved, autobiographical and exuding humanity catharsis of a pacifist who admires the beauty of warplanes, of a privileged person who, on the contrary of almost all his fellow citizens, he did not experience the hardships of war. The wind rises is the most painful way to say goodbye to a genius who chooses retirement; but, as the film teaches, "we must try to live".

title: Gare du Nord
actors: Nicole Garcia, Reda Kateb, François Damiens, Monia Chokri, Sophie Bredier, Michael Evans, Lucielle Vieaux, Marvin Jean Charles, Ibrahim Koma, Michael Dai, Christophe Paou
description: Ismael is fascinated by the Gare du Nord, one of the stations in Paris, which is his favorite place and the subject of his degree thesis as well as a busy and chaotic crossroads of people. It is precisely at the Gare du Nord that one morning Ismael meets Mathilde, a professor at the Sorbonne University who is often forced to pass by because of her illness. Gradually, Ismael introduces Mathilde to the world of the station and ends up falling in love with her. Their path then crosses those of Sacha, a candid camera actor in search of his daughter lost at the station, and of Joan, a young mother and former student of Mathilde who has become a real estate agent and is always traveling.

title: The Fake
description: In a rural village, destined to disappear by the will of the administration officials, a church is built and the elderly Choi asks the reverend Sung to be appointed to the head of the congregation, hiding the real intention of pocketing the compensation money that will go to Inhabitants of the village. To put their hands on the money that will go to his family and on the savings to make his daughter Young-Sun study is instead Min-Chul, a former resident of the village that returns home after a long time. Following a violent clash with Choi, Min-Chul is led to the police station but nobody is willing to listen to his truth about Choi's scammer activities. With the passage of time and with the aggravation of the conflict between the two due to the studies of You -Sun paid by Choi, the reverend Sung - moved by hatred - begins to show his true face and his very personal sense of justice against min-chul.

title: Før snøen faller
actors: Abdullah Taher, Suzan Ilir, Bahar Ozen, Billey Demirtas, Eva Medusa Gühne, Nazmi Kirik, Jin Musa, Volga Sorgu, Mohammed Tejir, Birol Ünel
description: When older sister Nermin runs away from an arranged marriage, young Siyar is forced to chase her to restore the family's honor. After leaving Kurdistan, Siyar finds himself in Istanbul, where he meets Evin, a street girl he falls in love with. As Nermin continued his escape to mainland Europe, Siyar and Evin continue together through Greece and Germany to reach Norway. During an odyssey that seems to have no end, Evin will be able to confront his notions of loyalty, dignity, honor and love, and see everything in a new light.

title: Au nom du fils
actors: Astrid Whettnall, Philippe Nahon, Achille Ridolfi, Albert Chassagne-Baradat, Zacharie Chasseriaud, Lionel Bourguet, Jacky Nercessian
description: Elisabeth, happy mother and caring wife, is the presenter of a popular show of a Catholic radio station and is an example of devotion for the whole local community of faithful so much so that she is the one who welcomes the young Italian priest Achille into the house, considering him since immediately a member of the family. But Elizabeth sees her life change radically when she discovers that Father Achille is actually a pedophile who has taken a liking to her son. Discovering the truth, Elisabeth tries to denounce Achilles to the ecclesiastical authorities but no one seems to give weight to his words, leaving her no choice but to resort to violence.

title: Sien nui yau wan
actors: Louis Koo, Yifei Liu, Shaoqun Yu, Kara Hui, Elvis Tsui, Siu-Wong Fan
description: Ning Caichen, a fearful young tax collector, is commissioned by a village administration to find a source of drinking water. During his search he comes across a cursed temple, where a group of demons in the guise of beautiful women lure passersby. Among them is Yan, who falls in love with the tax collector. The two will be helped by Yan Chixia, a valiant warrior, to face the wrath of Tree Demon, the leader of the demons.
notes: Remake of Chinese Ghost Stories, directed in 1987 by Ching Siu-tung

title: Fanny
actors: Raphaël Personnaz, Daniel Auteuil, Victoire Belezy, Jean-Pierre Darroussin, Ariane Ascaride, Marie-Anne Chazel, Daniel Russo, Nicolas Vaude
description: Fanny, in love and abandoned, discovers she has become pregnant with Marius. Thus she finds herself in the dramatic condition of a single mother, fighting for her own future and that of her child. With the approval of her mother and Marius's father, she then agrees to marry Honoré Panisse, the wealthy merchant who is thirty years her senior. A few months after the wedding, Marius will return from his trip and will try to win her back.
notes: Sequel to Marius (2013), inspired by the novel by Marcel Pagnol.

title: EunGyo
actors: Hae-il Park, Mu-Yeol Kim, Kim Go-Eun, Man-shik Jeong, Park Cheol-Hyeon, Jang Yun-sil, Jeong Seo-in, Kim Kyeong-il, Ahn Min-Yeong, Im Mi-Yeon
description: Lee Juk-so, a respected 70-year-old poet, lovingly cares for his 30-year-old disciple Seo Ji-Woo. But the two men's world is shaken when Han Eun-Gyo, a 17-year-old student who rekindles their minds and sexual desires, enters their lives. Inspired by what he is experiencing, Lee Juk-so writes a novel which he gives the name of the girl by title. Jealous of the relationship that his teacher has created with Eun-Gyo, Seo Ji-Woo takes possession of the literary work.

title: Omar
actors: Adam Bakri, Waleed Zuaiter, Samer Bisharat, Ehab Hourani, Leem Lubani
description: In the West Bank, Omar climbs a separation wall and challenges bullets for Nadia's sake. Thoughtful boy and hardworking baker, Omar is not afraid to face destiny, aware of the risks he runs: capture and maybe even torture. Tareq, Nadia's militant brother, instead works hard to protect her sister, tradition, her country and her friends. While fighting for different reasons, Omar and Tareq are both seeking freedom in a world where betrayal is the only way to survive.

title: L'image manquante
description: For many years, director Rithy Panh searched for a photograph taken between 1975 and 1979, when the Khmer Rouge held power in Cambodia. Convinced that a photograph, despite not being concrete evidence of a mass murder, allows us to think about many things, to meditate and rewrite history, he searched in vain for it in the archives, among old documents and in the countryside of Cambodia, arriving to the conclusion that it has been lost. He thus decided to resort to cinema, not returning a shot or the search for a single photograph but the image of a search.
notes: Rithy Panh's film is a shocking intimate gesture, a continuous research on the ethics of the image, another Ici et ailleurs, an essay on moral ecology on the representations that produce history.

title: The Major
actors: Denis Shvedov, Irina Nizina, Ilya Isaev, Yuri Bykov
description: Sergey Sobolev, a police officer, is on his way to the hospital, where his wife is about to give birth to their child. From happiness, he proceeds at high speed and runs over a guy almost without realizing it. Faced with the possibility of ending up in prison, Sergey decides to compromise with his conscience and invites his police friends to help him. Fate, however, makes this choice cause the death of many people and leads Sergey to change his mind, finding himself the whole system against.

title: Jodorowsky's Dune
actors: Alejandro Jodorowsky, Nicolas Winding Refn, H.R. Giger, Richard Stanley, Gary Kurtz, Brontis Jodorowsky, Devin Faraci, Drew McWeeny, Michel Seydoux, Chris Foss, Syd Garon
description: In 1974, director Alejandro Jodorowsky decided to adapt Frank Helbert's science fiction novel "Dune" for the big screen. As production stalled over two years, Jodorowski and his team of then-unknown collaborators continued to explore the project's themes and styles, bringing their results into other works that changed the course of modern science fiction. Thanks to that research, HR Ginger brought his contributions to Ridley Scott's Alien, Dan O'Bannon wrote Alien and Act of Force, Jean Giraud created the futuristic worlds of The Empire Strikes Back, Tron and The Fifth Element, and Chris Foss worked on Alien and Superman.

title: Jigoku de naze warui
actors: Jun Kunimura, Shin'Ichi Tsutsumi, Fumi Nikaidô, Tomochika, Hiroki Hasegawa, Gen Hoshino, Tak Sakaguchi, Kotou Lorena
description: Muto and Ikegami are two gangsters who hate each other but Ikegami is in love with Michicko, the actress daughter of Muto that her mother Shizue would like to see appear in a movie. After being mistaken for a director, the young cinephile Koji asks independent director Hirata to choose Michiko as the protagonist of his next work but the situation soon takes a wrong turn.

title: The Stone Roses: Made of Stone
actors: Ian Brown, John Squire, Gary Mounfield, Alan Wren
description: In 2012, after 16 years of separation, the members of the legendary band The Stone Roses decided to reform. Using unpublished repertoire material and closely following the musicians at work for the reunion and grappling with daily life, the documentary takes the opportunity to retrace the history of the group and go behind the scenes of the three sold out concerts to be held at the 'Heaton Park in Manchester in front of 220,000 fans in fibrillation.

title: Die andere Heimat - Chronik einer Sehnsucht
actors: Maximilian Scheidt, Jan Schneider, Marita Breuer, Werner Herzog, Rüdiger Kriese, Antonia Bill, Philine Lembeck, Mélanie Fouché, Eva Zeidler
description: Against the backdrop of rural Germany in the mid-nineteenth century, when entire villages were depopulated due to hunger and poverty and emigration to distant South America was the order of the day, two brothers one day find themselves faced with the most difficult of dilemmas: to stay or leave. their land. Jacob, unusually romantic for a country boy, dreams of finding paradise in Brazil and makes plans with his great love, the daughter of a stonemason from his village. The return of his brother Gustav from military service, however, gives rise to events that will give a completely different direction to Jacob's projects.
notes: Reitz turns with a beautiful, warm and mellow black and white, underlining in a pictorial sense the charm of a ruthless land and with his umpteenth, fluvial masterpiece he pursues in an ancestral, almost mythological past, that imaginary elsewhere of which the West has still need it today to survive itself.

title: Rosie
actors: Sibylle Brunner, Louis Krähenbühl, Sebastian Ledesma, Judith Hofmann, Fabian Krüger, Anna-Katharina Müller
description: Lorenz Meran, a 40-year-old successful gay author suffering from classic writer's block, must leave Berlin and return to Eastern Switzerland to take care of his elderly mother Rosie. Discovering that his mother refuses to both be cared for and be admitted to a nursing home, Lorenz realizes that he must spend much more time in his hometown, where a battle against his midlife crisis awaits him and a mother who instead he does not want to lose his dignity due to old age. When some long-kept family secrets suddenly come to light, Lorenz hardly notices that love has come back into his life.

title: Sakasama no Patema
description: Patema, a thirteen -year -old girl who lives in a basement, slips by chance in a world upside down. Her meeting with her will allow her to discover curious universes very different from her.

title: It's Such a Beautiful Day
description: A series of dark and disturbing events forces Bill to come to terms with the meaning of his existence and attempt to piece together the pieces of his shattered psyche.

title: 2 automnes 3 hivers
actors: Vincent Macaigne, Maud Wyler, Bastien Bouillon, Thomas Blanchard, Audrey Bastien, Olivier Chantreau, Jean-Quentin Châtelain, Pauline Etienne
description: Arman and Benjamin are two best friends, in their thirties, single and without a specific goal in life. When he happens to be attacked, Arman is lucky enough to see the beautiful Amélie enter his life. But fate is unpredictable and Benjamin suffers a stroke. From that moment on, in the space of a couple of years, the lives of Amélie, Arman and Benjamin will become more and more intertwined.

title: Kaguyahime no monogatari
description: An old man sells bamboo to survive. One day, in the bamboo canes, he finds a little princess, the size of a finger, named Kaguya. As Kaguya grows up, five men from as many prestigious families express a desire to marry her. Kaguya ask them to find five memorable gifts for her but no one is able to bring her what she really wants.
notes: Artistically, "The story of the shining princess" is the culmination of a stylistic elaboration matured in an excellent career, capable of blending the animation from the large white spaces already in the previous 1999 My Neighbors the Yamadas with a recognizable "Ghibli" design.

title: E agora? Lembra-me
actors: Joaquim Pinto, Nuno Leonel
description: For another twenty years Joaquim Pinto has been living with HIV and VHC viruses. For a year now he has undergone clinical trials with still unapproved drugs that alter the state of mind. His film, in addition to documenting the past year, is an open and eclectic reflection on memory, disease and globalization, on survival beyond all expectations, on dissent and absolute love. In a continuous coming and going between memories and the present, it is also a tribute to friends who are now gone and to those who have remained.

title: The Armstrong Lie
actors: Lance Armstrong
description: Focused initially on the comeback attempt and efforts of cyclist Lance Armstrong to win his eighth Tour de France, the documentary takes on a different tone after Armstrong is forced to admit the use of doping substances following a federal criminal investigation and public allegations of doping made by his former teammates.

title: Je m'appelle Hmmm...
actors: Douglas Gordon, Lou-Léila Demerliac, Sylvie Testud, Jacques Bonnaffé, Marie-Christine Barrault, Jean-Pierre Kalfon, Jean-François Garreaud, Benn Northover, Grégoire Colin, Frans Boyer, Emmanuel Gayet
description: Eleven-year-old Céline meets forty-year-old Peter. Together they set off on a "bright escape" in his red truck. She is on the run from a desperate and incestuous father while Peter is away from his native England and the sad memory of his lost wife and daughter. Over the course of a few days, Céline will experience the lightness, cheerfulness and confidence of her age for the first time.
notes: The pages pile up with irrational impetus, ripple with black and white inserts, drawings, films and other abrupt variations of style, swell with appearances and overflow from the margins, leaving the reader / viewer now overwhelmed, now exhausted. The bond between Céline and her "kidnapper" is convincing, who, due to the difficult bilingual communication, ends up being based on small gestures, looks and outbursts of affection: an anomalous and indigestible couple for society, recalls some tender and battered characters of her companion Korine. But the film of the late debutant does not keep the road as much as Peter's truck, it swerves between gory contents and forced lyricisms, derails in the blood melt and closes itself in mystery, like a private diary intelligible only to the owner.

title: Ruin
actors: Rous Muni, Siek Somalen
description: Phirun and Sovanna are two young Cambodians who live alone in a violent context and whose worlds compete through a series of premonitions over vast bodies of water. Inexplicably attracted to each other, Phirun and Sovanna find themselves even closer after a sudden and brutal murder, committed in self-defense, forces them to flee the city and venture into the jungle.

title: La vida después
actors: Américo Hollander, Rodrigo Azuela, María Renée Prudencio
description: Samuel and Rodrigo begin a journey in search of their mother, who disappeared in a strange way after leaving a message saying that she had to go away. As the two brothers travel through a desert landscape that brings back old childhood memories, their relationship will become increasingly strained and close to fracturing.

title: John Ford et Monument Valley
actors: Peter Cowie, Henry Fonda, John Ford, Martin Scorsese, James Stewart, John Wayne
description: In 1939, the movie Red Shadows created three icons: John Wayne, John Ford and Monument Valley. However, few know the story behind the choice to set the film in Monument Valley. Driving Ford to shoot in that area was the desire and determination of a breeder named Harry Goulding, who with his wife traveled to Hollywood with enchanting images of his land. Subjugated by those shots, Ford shot Red Shadows in Monument Valley and started a solid connection with the place, dubbed by all the "land of Ford" and used as a backdrop for other works such as Hell's Challenge, The Fort Apache Massacre or Rio. Good boy.

title: Death Row II - Portrait: Blaine Milam
description: Blaine Milam is the youngest inmate on death row in Texas. He and his girlfriend, Jessica Carson, were convicted of the murder of their 13-month-old daughter during an exorcism. They were convinced that she was possessed by the devil.

title: Death Row II - Portrait: Darlie Routier
description: Darlie Routier is incarcerated on death row for stabbing her two children. After the fact, she was found with a stab wound on her neck. She swears on her innocence, claiming she was attacked by a man who broke into the house.

title: Death Row II - Portrait: Douglas Feldman
description: After a childhood devoted to drugs and petty theft, Douglas Feldman finished high school with excellent grades. He traveled around the world before murdering the driver of an articulated lorry. Witnesses report that he approached the moving vehicle aboard a motorcycle and fired repeated shots. About 30 minutes later, in Dallas, Texas, Douglas Feldman pulled his motorcycle over to another articulated truck at a gas station and shot the truck driver, killing a second man.

title: Death Row II - Portrait: Robert Fratta
description: Robert Fratta hired two hit men to assassinate his wife who was about to leave him. On death row, both fellow prisoners and guards describe him as the scariest person they have ever known.

title: Feng Ai
description: 50 men live for 12 months in an isolated asylum, spending their days on a single floor and having little contact with the medical team. Each of the inmates is there not for mental health problems but for killing someone or committing some crime against public officials.

title: Mahi va gorbeh
actors: Babak Karimi, Saeed Ebrahimi Far, Abed Abes
description: During the winter solstice, some students travel to the Caspian region to take part in a gathering of kites. Near their campsite there is a small hut occupied by three cooks who work in a nearby restaurant looking for meat to cook.
notes: Shot in a single take, the film is based on the true story of a restaurant that served ground human meat.

title: Trespassing Bergman
actors: Ang Lee, Isabella Rossellini, Harriet Andersson, Zhang Yimou, Woody Allen, Laura Dern, Francis Ford Coppola, Takeshi Kitano, Holly Hunter, Wes Anderson, Robert De Niro, Martin Scorsese, Lars von Trier, Ridley Scott, Mona Malm, Pernilla August, Wes Craven, Alexander Payne, Tomas Alfredson, Daniel Espinosa, Thomas Vinterberg
description: Director Ingmar Bergman built his house on the island of Faro in the mid -sixties of the twentieth century, choosing to move from Stockholm to the island on the Baltic Sea. Throughout his life, the house remained a well -kept secret place and after his death he was preserved as a museum. The documentary crosses the threshold of the home to retrace the history of the director, his island and some of his most important films, with the help of interviews with the most important filmmakers in the world who tell how much Bergman means for them.

title: Sparrows Dance
actors: Marin Ireland, Paul Sparks, Niesha Butler, Bennie Slay, Zoran Radanovich, Anthony Arkin, Ben Buschel, Alex Estes, Kate Levine
description: When stage fright takes over her, an actress decides to never leave her apartment, paralyzed as she is by fear of the outside world. Living on food delivered to her home and memories of her career, the woman spends her days in front of the television and spying on the city from the window. When her bathroom has problems, a plumber shows up at her door, which she slowly allows to enter her universe.

title: Master of the Universe
actors: Rainer Voss
description: Former German banker Rainer Voss was one of the leaders of the financial sector of Germany and with his work he generated millions of profits. From a deserted bank in the middle of Frankfurt, Voss breaks for the first time the silence on his career as a "dominator of the financial universe" and, answering the questions of the director Marc Bauder, traces his rise that began in the eighties of the twentieth century, In conjunction with the increase in the power of banks, and analyzes the economic world, proposing its vision on global crises.
notes: In its impassive description of the damage caused by a job that does not contemplate individual responsibility, the trader's life becomes something between the monastery and the army. A system whose logic have nothing to do with man, with the needs and will of him, but only with those of the capital: Bauder's film is the ideal complement of The Wolf of Wall Street.

title: The Untold History of the United States
actors: Oliver Stone, Alan Shearman, Jim Ward, André Sogliuzzo
description: Narrated by Oliver Stone and written by the director himself with peter Kuznick, the documentary - in twelve parts - focuses on those human events, which underestimated by the media and history books, helped to change and shape the United States during the twentieth century. .

title: Cheatin'
description: Jake and Ella get to know each other by colliding with their cars in a car accident. Following the collision, a wonderful love story begins between the two. However, soon the ghost of jealousy will make its appearance and, with the help of a not-so-honest wizard and his forbidden soul machine, an insecure and resentful Ella will take on the likeness of Jake's many lovers. However, not everything will go as planned.

title: Il flauto
actors: Patrizio Oliva, Francesca Ferri, Mister Lei, Totonno Chiappetta, Loredana Trombetta, Sonia Di Pascali, Giuseppe Franco, Fausto Saponara, Sante Ceci, Pietro Daniele Aldrovandi
description: Gennaro Esposito, an ignorant garbage man, finds himself on a particular island, where men in uniform roam without memory under the control of a strange staff. This is the place where souls are waiting to be born, under the control of an alien multinational that has as its purpose the exploitation and total globalization of planet Earth. With simplicity and innocence, the only weapons in his possession, Gennaro will be able to upset the current order by helping souls to recover their memories and infecting them with the virus of freedom.
notes: The tight budget, evident in the special effects in clumsy computer graphics, knocks out Capponi's visionary and poetic ambitions like not even Oliva in the heyday: between science fiction and new age, naked girls and fake-neorealist flashbacks, moments as a music maker and actors non-professionals in disarray, The flute seems to play a score of its own, a weird and out of tune hymn to life staged with amateur means. Eventually, the saving power of music redeems souls from their oblivion, but if heaven can wait, cinema will still have to wait a long time.

title: O Menino e o Mundo
description: Heartbroken by his father's absence, a child leaves his village and discovers a fantasy world dominated by machine animals and strange beings.
notes: Animated film made with different techniques to represent, through the eyes of the young protagonist, the problems of the modern world. An enthralling and apocalyptic circus of colors, between paper and CGI, surrealist collage and documentary: explosive in figurative invention, refined for the way it weaves a daring and not easily readable plot, but emotionally understandable to everyone.

title: Saatvin Sair
actors: Paramjit Singh, Shiwali, Subhi Devi
description: A wandering painter immerses himself in a wood after noticing a mysterious imprint and heard a strange melody. During his journey, he stops under a tree and falls asleep: in his sleep he sees himself walking and painting, some stones that challenge the force of gravity, a girl who travels the celestial vault to make her daily delivery of fruit and milk, The seasons that change and the years that spend. The painter wakes up and moves within a landscape made by his own paintings in which he could find him waiting for him the reason for his research.

title: Mandariinid
actors: Lembit Ulfsak, Elmo Nüganen, Mikhail Meskhi, Giorgi Nakashidze, Raivo Trass
description: Autumn is normally one of the most beautiful seasons in Abkhazia but this cannot be said for that of 1992. Abkhazia is struggling to separate from Georgia and there is a war going on. People are on the run and only two inhabitants remain in one village, two impartial Estonians: Markus and Ivo. Markus did not run away because he wants to harvest his mandarins, despite Ivo being against harvesting crops in wartime. Gradually, the conflict approaches before their eyes and one day Ivo finds Akhmed, a wounded survivor of the battlefield. Despite the danger, she decides to take him home and take care of him. While he is intent on burying some dead Georgians, Markus also finds a survivor. In this way, both Ivo and Marku have two wounded soldiers under their roof. By chance these are sworn enemies and a new war begins.

title: Atlas
description: An unattached man, who has survived a long journey, collects delusional images, scattered fragments of an identity as atomized as the territories he travels through. Thus he finds himself dealing with the strangeness of unfathomable signs, places and languages. In his night, there is no god or indulgence but only the acceptance that only the flesh exists.

title: Striplife
directors: Nicola Grignani, Alberto Mussolini, Luca Scaffidi, Valeria Testagrossa, Andrea Zambelli
description: Life in the Gaza Strip is described through the eyes of the younger generations, characterized by small but profound signs of resistance. While some young people are practicing to overcome any obstacle, others denounce in their own way the unbearable situation that is experienced in the strip.
notes: A vital and dry choral portrait that avoids, sometimes programmatically, the rhetoric on the controversial issues that involve Gaza, contrasting glimpses of hyperkinetic dynamism with the deadly habit of TV news. A cinematically rigorous operation, less spontaneous than its protagonists, but commendable.

title: I fantasmi di San Berillo
description: San Berillo is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Catania. Between destroyed houses and degraded alleys, painful or ironic stories of an idealized past and a present to be restored are traced: myth, popular culture and closed houses are the background to a journey that shows what remains of an area suspended in time and populated from ghosts of yesterday and today.
notes: Fascinating and repulsive, enchanting and degraded: the stars rain down on San Berillo as in a sweet collective hallucination and the stories of a marginality that knows myth and abandonment unfold, intimately linked in the images captured by the documentary by Edoardo Morabito that crosses with magical naturalness the cobbled and very narrow streets, gives voice to past but above all present ghosts, and cradles this (never) forgotten reality, tough yet poetic, with the words of Italo Calvino and Goliarda Sapienza.

title: Vie sauvage
actors: Mathieu Kassovitz, Céline Sallette, David Gastou, Sofiane Neveu, Jules Rittmanic, Romain Depret, Jenna Thiam
description: Philippe Fournier, known as Paco, lives with his six and seven-year-old children, who have chosen not to return to their mother who had been entrusted with their custody. Living in a hidden way, the little Okyesa and Tsali often take on a different identity to escape the police. Barns, farmhouses, caravans and various communities allow them to be in tune with animals and nature and to overcome dangers and fears. Their nomadic existence will go on for eleven years, during which - crossing all of France - they will form their personality.

title: Mommy
actors: Anne Dorval, Antoine Olivier Pilon, Suzanne Clément, Patrick Huard, Alexandre Goyette, Michèle Lituac, Viviane Pacal, Nathalie Hamel-Roy
description: In a fictional Canada, where a new law allows parents to leave problematic children in the care of the hospital system, Die Despres, an exuberant widow, tries to raise their son Steve, a boy with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. As they both try to make ends meet by living under the same roof, mysterious neighbor Kyla offers them her help. As Kyla's comforting presence becomes more intense, questions arise about her past life and how her destiny can be related to that of Steve and Die.
notes: Mature cover of Dolan's first film, it is a cheeky and impetuous, urgent and naive pop melody, who enjoys and pines in kitsch but does not reduce man to speck, who joyfully seeks the invention of cinema but knows how to be a story healthily popular. It is a wonderfully queer film: because it seeks the balance of love outside the canonical forms, from social dogmas, from biological ties, from the couple format.

title: The Raid 2: Berandal
actors: Iko Uwais, Yayan Ruhian, Arifin Putra, Oka Antara, Tio Pakusodewo, Alex Abbad, Julie Estelle, Cok Simbara, Raiden Integra, Donny Alamsyah, Ryuhei Matsuda, Kazuki Kitamura, Ken'ichi Endô, Marsha Timothy, Cecep Arif Rahman
description: After fighting to find a way out of a building full of gangsters and madmen, the policeman Rama thought he could return to a normal life but he is very wrong: the enemies faced, although formidable, were small in front of the big shots. of the underworld. To protect his wife and unborn child, Rama has no choice but to infiltrate the criminal ranks and attempt to climb their ranks, starting a new odyssey of violence. Forced to put his identity aside, he must be able to gain the trust of Uco, son of the boss of a prominent gang, and join the gang in order to uproot its roots from within and denounce the corruption that lies between the forces of police.
notes: Sequel to The Raid: Redemption (2011).

title: Sneezing Baby Panda - The Movie
actors: Amber Clayton, Jane Ubrien, Nick Stribakos, Gao Xiaowen, Grant Piro, Abbe Holmes, Nicholas Stratford, Annie Jones
description: Coming across a YouTube video featuring a small panda, Australian zoologist Marnie Tyler is convinced that the cub could be the key to salvation for her threatened zoo. Marnie's search to find the panda soon collides with a reality not taken into consideration: inhabitants of remote Chinese villages who have never seen the video and foreign competitors who first set out on the animal's trail.

title: Doctor Who - The Day of the Doctor
actors: Matt Smith, David Tennant, Jenna Coleman, Billie Piper, John Hurt, Joanna Page, Jemma Redgrave, Ingrid Oliver, Ken Bones, Orlando James
description: In 2013 something terrible is awakening at the National Gallery in London. In 1562, however, a murderous plot was running its course in Elizabethan England. Somewhere in space, finally, an ancient battle reaches its devastating conclusion.
notes: Special episode made for the 50th anniversary of the Doctor Who TV series.

title: Unsere Mütter, unsere Väter
actors: Volker Bruch, Tom Schilling, Katharina Schüttler, Miriam Stein, Ludwig Trepte, Mark Waschke, Henriette Richter-Röhl, Götz Schubert, Hildegard Schroedter, Christiane Paul
description: Five young German friends are forced to move between harassment and compromise in Germany under Hitler. Highly decorated officer Wilhelm heads to the eastern front with his sensitive younger brother Friedhelm. Deeply in love with Wilhelm is Charlotte, a young nurse who works for the Red Cross. Greta, on the other hand, is a talented singer who aspires to become the new Marlene Dietrich as her Jewish boyfriend Viktor fights for his life by hiding among the members of the Polish Resistance.

title: Matar a un hombre
actors: Daniel Candia, Daniel Antivilo, Alejandra Yañez, Ariel Mateluna
description: Jorge, a hard-working family man who can barely make ends meet, is attacked by Kalule, a neighborhood thug. Jorge's son then decides to face the attacker but ends up having the worst of it. Although the young man almost dies, the sentence remedied by Kalule is minimal and this only increases the friction.

title: Kelebegin ruyasi
actors: Kivanç Tatlitug, Mert Firat, Belcim Bilgin, Farah Zeynep Abdullah, Yilmaz Erdogan, Ahmet Mümtaz Taylan, Taner Birsel, Selman Unlusoy, Ipek Bilgin, Aksel Bonfil
description: In 1941 in Zonguldak, an impoverished mining city on the Turkish coast of the Black Sea, two young and talented poets, friends and rivals, make a bet to decide who of the two can court the beautiful daughter of an aristocrat. At the same time, the two poets also have to do with more serious problems to face: diseases, poverty, mandatory work in the coal mines and the threat of an impending World War.

title: Praia do Futuro
actors: Wagner Moura, Clemens Schick, Jesuíta Barbosa, Savio Ygor Ramos, Sophie Charlotte Conrad, Sabine Timoteo, Fred Lima, Natascha Paulick, Emily Cox, Yannik Burwiek
description: Donato works as a lifeguard on the Praia do Futuro beach and courageously saves the lives of all those who end up in danger in the waters. One day, Donato rescues two German tourists on vacation but manages to save only one, Konrad. Waiting for the body of Konrad's friend to be returned from the sea, between Donato and the German a deep friendship is born that soon turns into love, so much so that the lifeguard has to abandon everything and move to Berlin. Years later, Ayrton, Donato's younger brother, goes to the German capital to find out the reasons for this move and the silence that ensued. As already happened with Donato, Berlin will end up giving Ayrton confusion and nostalgia on the one hand and hope on the other.

title: Thou Wast Mild and Lovely
actors: Joe Swanberg, Sophie Traub, Robert Longstreet, Kristin Slaysman, Matt Orme, Geoff Marslett, Shelley Delaney
description: A love story set on a farm in the Kentucky countryside full of compressed sensuality and ambiguity. The protagonists are the young Sarah (Sophie Traub), her father Jeremiah (Robert Longstreet) and Arkin (Joe Swanberg), the man they hired as a helper.
notes: Inspired by the novel The Valley of Eden.

title: Casa Grande
actors: Thales Cavalcanti, Marcello Novaes, Suzana Pires, Alice Melo, Bruna Amaya, Clarissa Pinheiro
description: Seventeen-year-old Jean grew up in the upper neighborhoods of Rio de Janeiro, in a context made up of private schools, drivers and housekeepers. As Jean, in his senior year of secondary school, tries to evade the worries of his overprotective parents, they silently face the approach of impending financial bankruptcy. Without letting Jean and her younger sister know, the father has in fact squandered all his money.

title: Natural Resistance
description: Four Italian winemakers live a life that everyone dreams of but are also protagonists of an international revolution in defense of natural wine and their ecologically and culturally progressive dream. Relying on local traditions that have been handed down for years and years, the winemakers fight the rules set by the European Union and by trade associations. The images of their vineyards are followed by footage from the Cineteca di Bologna, which reveal the deep and ancient relationship between culture and agriculture.
notes: "Natural Resistance" is not just a film about natural wine, about the rules imposed by Brussels and the difficulty of creating a different product "from the earth", risking sanctions and ostracism from industrial agriculture, but above all about the revolutionary and artistic value of natural agriculture, in times of crisis and socio-economic changes. The point of view is obviously only one and not very objective, but the author wants to celebrate a model, not to offer a general picture: he believes in it, his interlocutors believe in it, and there is nothing wrong with hoping that we arrive at believe us too.

title: Mission Blue
actors: Sylvia Earle, James Cameron, Michael deGruy, Jeremy Jackson, Carl Safina
description: Sylvia Earle, oceanographer, marine biologist, conservationist and National Geographic journalist, launches a worldwide campaign to create a network of protected marine reserves.

title: Pierrot Lunaire
actors: Susanne Sachsse, Paulina Bachmann, Boris Lisowski, Mehdi Berkouki, Krishna Kumar Krishnan
description: A girl, who regularly dresses as a man, falls in love with another young girl and seduces her, without her knowing her real sex. When the young woman introduces her "boyfriend" to her father, the man immediately appears skeptical and manages to unmask the deception. The feelings of the daughter, however, do not change but the father forbids her to see her "beloved" again, prompting the "boyfriend" to come up with an adventurous plan to show him his masculinity.

title: Ninja: Shadow of a Tear
actors: Scott Adkins, Kane Kosugi, Mika Hijii, Shun Sugata, Vithaya Pansringarm, Mukesh Bhatt, Tim Man, Jawed El Berni, Saichia Wongwirot, Shogo Tanikawa
description: Casey (Scott Adkins) while his wife who died with strange wounds in the throat is returning home. Determined to take revenge, Casey eliminates what he believes to be responsible and then hosted in Thailand in the Dojo managed by his friend Nakatara (Kane Kosugi). Here Casey soon discovers that strange events take place in that martial arts school, and that they have to do with the murder of the woman he loved.

title: Racing Extinction
description: Director Louie Psihoyos assembles a team of activists to show the world never-before-seen images that change the way people look at endangered animal and mass extinction issues by infiltrating notorious black markets with tactics in guerrilla style or working with artists to create beautiful images with unexpected animal subjects.

title: Peter Gabriel - Back to Front
actors: Peter Gabriel, Tony Levin, David Rhodes, Manu Katché, David Sancious
